story:
Give a man a fish and you will feed him for a day; show him how to fish and you will feed him for a lifetime.

Break the cycle of poverty by Giving the Gift of Literacy.

Donate a Dollar!

Dyslexia International has created a free on-line resource so that teachers around the world can understand what dyslexia is, how to identify it and how to address it in the classroom.

For more information on the course please see this video e-Campus

With just $10,000 we can hire the expertise to roll this out to 190 countries.

"Education is the basic tool for the development of consciousness and the reconstitution of society." – Mahatma Ghandi

 

Quentin Blake's ABC

We are honoured to have 25 signed copies of Sir Quentin Blake's ABC to give away. Please see the perks to the right to claim yours!

 

Memory Champion Dominic O'Brien

This is a unique chance to spend three hours with memory champion Dominic O'Brien, to learn the secrets of how to improve your memory and have fun along the way. Please see the perks to the right to claim yours!

 

T-Shirt

Grab your Give the Gift of Literacy T-Shirt!

 

 

What is dyslexia?

Dyslexia is a neurologically-based condition, which is often hereditary.

It results in problems with:

  • reading
  • writing
  • spelling

and is usually associated with difficulties in:

  • concentration
  • short term memory
  • organization

Dyslexia is not the result of stupidity.

It is not caused by:

  • poor schooling
  • poor home background
  • poor motivation for learning
  • clinically manifest poor sight, hearing or muscle control – although it may occur with these conditions

 

About Dyslexia International

Founded in 2000 as a registered, not-for-profit organization in Belgium, we have:

  • worked with the BBC on two projects: an awareness raising television programme Language Shock – Dyslexia across cultures, and a tri-lingual self-help CD Tintin helps dyslexia learners;
  • organized the first World Dyslexia Forum at UNESCO 2O1O;
  • created Open Courseware and a range of Open Educational Resources
  • created an e-Campus for teachers and trainers and policy makers.

We work with experts in the field of dyslexia, neuro-physiology and psychology to build our materials.

As an NGO in consultative status with UNESCO, we are able to share expertise in teaching literacy with more than 190 countries’ ministries of education.

Our major sponsors have included Levi Strauss, Microsoft, Cable & Wireless.  The Oak Foundation is our primary sponsor for setting up our new e-Campus.

Please visit our website: Dyslexia International

 

Testimonials from teachers, trainers ministries, universities using our free online resources:

"I must congratulate you on your phenomenal achievement in bringing together scholarship, evidence, exercises, illustrations and audio visual material.” Catherine Martinet, Professor, Switzerland

"Superb work that will enable teacher to understand how pupils with dyslexia function in class. Your research is outstanding...” Marie-Jeanne Petiniot, Teacher, Belgium

"The on-line course is so valuable in educating the educators in all aspect of Dyslexia. Many fail to understand how dyslexic children learn...” Sue Newton, SEN teacher, UK

"I particularly liked the breadth that you incorporated within the course, from neurology, definition, processes involved in reading and writing, the practical help for wider issues such as the social and emotional effects of such a diagnosis (or lack of one) on parents and child alike ... I find the course extremely interesting, very well organized, very useful and covering dyslexia from many point of views that can answer any questions for educators, parents, scientists as well as any person that wants to know about dyslexia...” Maria K., Ph.D., Teacher, Athens, Greece

"This online course has been fantastic! I really like how I am able to click on each section, read and print all the information. I can also print great informal reading assessments to use right away in the classroom. I have also enjoyed the research and wealth of information. I am learning so much and solidifying what I already believed. The writing samples, sound clips and diagrams have been helpful too.” Christy H., Teacher, Switzerland

"I find the structure very logical and easy to follow.

The diagrams are very useful and give variety rather then reading a bunch of text... I can see this may help – even students that have no learning difficulties at all by knowing the science behind the process of learning...

I find the personal accounts interesting because no one can describe better what it feels like than the people that experience it.” Elizabeth K., Teacher, Belgium

"This is the first time I’ve taken an online course and I’m thrilled with the course format, animated illustrations (especially while reading about brain processes) and the plethora of information compacted in such well-organised units. It is easy to follow and makes reading go by fast because it is presented in such a user-friendly layout that the homework doesn’t feel like homework. The video clips of students with dyslexia help connect theoretical text into applicable and useful correlations to reality and what a normal child experiences at school with teacher who are not trained or conscience of reading problems.” Sophia M., Teacher, Poland


"The What To Do section is brilliant – extremely practical ideas for supporting parents and improving school environment. I see it as being a wonderful resource for daily teaching. I would love to see this course in any university that is responsible for teacher training, but also offered online for teachers who need to know more about dyslexia (because many have received no training in this area, but have been teaching for years!). It is always rewarding to revisit materials that encourage the implementation of best practice and make teachers reflect on their current teaching techniques. It made me remember some important things that I had forgotten!” Jeanette T., Teacher, Geneva, Switzerland

For more information on the course please see this video e-Campus
With just $10,000 we can hire the expertise to roll this out to 190 countries.
"Education is the basic tool for the development of consciousness and the reconstitution of society." – Mahatma Ghandi
 
Quentin Blake's ABC
We are honoured to have 25 signed copies of Sir Quentin Blake's ABC to give away. Please see the perks to the right to claim yours!

 
Memory Champion Dominic O'Brien
This is a unique chance to spend three hours with memory champion Dominic O'Brien, to learn the secrets of how to improve your memory and have fun along the way. Please see the perks to the right to claim yours!

 
T-Shirt
Grab your Give the Gift of Literacy T-Shirt!
 

 
What is dyslexia?
Dyslexia is a neurologically-based condition, which is often hereditary.
It results in problems with:

reading
writing
spelling
and is usually associated with difficulties in:

concentration
short term memory
organization
Dyslexia is not the result of stupidity.
It is not caused by:

poor schooling
poor home background
poor motivation for learning
clinically manifest poor sight, hearing or muscle control – although it may occur with these conditions
 
About Dyslexia International
Founded in 2000 as a registered, not-for-profit organization in Belgium, we have:

worked with the BBC on two projects: an awareness raising television programme Language Shock – Dyslexia across cultures, and a tri-lingual self-help CD Tintin helps dyslexia learners;

organized the first World Dyslexia Forum at UNESCO 2O1O;
created Open Courseware and a range of Open Educational Resources
created an e-Campus for teachers and trainers and policy makers.
We work with experts in the field of dyslexia, neuro-physiology and psychology to build our materials.
As an NGO in consultative status with UNESCO, we are able to share expertise in teaching literacy with more than 190 countries’ ministries of education.
Our major sponsors have included Levi Strauss, Microsoft, Cable & Wireless.  The Oak Foundation is our primary sponsor for setting up our new e-Campus.
Please visit our website: Dyslexia International
 
Testimonials from teachers, trainers ministries, universities using our free online resources:
"I must congratulate you on your phenomenal achievement in bringing together scholarship, evidence, exercises, illustrations and audio visual material.” Catherine Martinet, Professor, Switzerland
"Superb work that will enable teacher to understand how pupils with dyslexia function in class. Your research is outstanding...” Marie-Jeanne Petiniot, Teacher, Belgium
"The on-line course is so valuable in educating the educators in all aspect of Dyslexia. Many fail to understand how dyslexic children learn...” Sue Newton, SEN teacher, UK
"I particularly liked the breadth that you incorporated within the course, from neurology, definition, processes involved in reading and writing, the practical help for wider issues such as the social and emotional effects of such a diagnosis (or lack of one) on parents and child alike ... I find the course extremely interesting, very well organized, very useful and covering dyslexia from many point of views that can answer any questions for educators, parents, scientists as well as any person that wants to know about dyslexia...” Maria K., Ph.D., Teacher, Athens, Greece
"This online course has been fantastic! I really like how I am able to click on each section, read and print all the information. I can also print great informal reading assessments to use right away in the classroom. I have also enjoyed the research and wealth of information. I am learning so much and solidifying what I already believed. The writing samples, sound clips and diagrams have been helpful too.” Christy H., Teacher, Switzerland
"I find the structure very logical and easy to follow.
The diagrams are very useful and give variety rather then reading a bunch of text... I can see this may help – even students that have no learning difficulties at all by knowing the science behind the process of learning...
I find the personal accounts interesting because no one can describe better what it feels like than the people that experience it.” Elizabeth K., Teacher, Belgium
"This is the first time I’ve taken an online course and I’m thrilled with the course format, animated illustrations (especially while reading about brain processes) and the plethora of information compacted in such well-organised units. It is easy to follow and makes reading go by fast because it is presented in such a user-friendly layout that the homework doesn’t feel like homework. The video clips of students with dyslexia help connect theoretical text into applicable and useful correlations to reality and what a normal child experiences at school with teacher who are not trained or conscience of reading problems.” Sophia M., Teacher, Poland
"The What To Do section is brilliant – extremely practical ideas for supporting parents and improving school environment. I see it as being a wonderful resource for daily teaching. I would love to see this course in any university that is responsible for teacher training, but also offered online for teachers who need to know more about dyslexia (because many have received no training in this area, but have been teaching for years!). It is always rewarding to revisit materials that encourage the implementation of best practice and make teachers reflect on their current teaching techniques. It made me remember some important things that I had forgotten!” Jeanette T., Teacher, Geneva, Switzerland

story:
Zachery was invited to be a part of People to People's Ambassador program, however we are a low income family and do not have the means to make that kind of money on our own. So we are asking friends and family and anyone else willing to help us raise the money.

 

While it would be nice if this campaign would raise the total sum on its own we aren’t holding our breaths, so while this campaign is circling the net Zack and his siblings will be running the streets selling candy and asking for donations.

 

This is an opportunity to help a child see a bit of the world outside his local town so any help you can provide, even if it’s just sharing this campaign info with your friends and family we would be very grateful.

story:
Transform the Lives of D.C. Students with Access to Worldclass Arts and Humanities Experiences

Send 3,000 Students to D.C. Cultural Institutions


The city of Washington, D.C., is rich in arts and culture but budget constraints often prevent the city’s public schools (of which, about 80% of the students are on free or reduced lunch) from taking advantage of its resources. The D.C. Arts and Humanities Education Collaborative is a non-profit 501(c)3 membership organization comprised of more than 70 of the world's premier cultural institutions, dedicated to providing 30,000 DC public and public charter school students with access to unparalleled arts and humanities experiences a year. We believe that arts access leads to student success! Since our founding 15 years ago in October of 1998, the Arts for Every Student (AFES) program has arranged for free tickets and transportation for 400,000 students in our nation's capital to our member’s curriculum-enriching fieldtrip opportunities!  


 

Students at the Corcoran Gallery of Art "American Stories" Tour where they investigate social studies and culture through the narratives presented in American works of art. The interaction includes discussion, writing activities and a studio art project.


We need your help!  We are looking to raise $20,000 to provide transportation and free tickets to 3,000 students to our member arts and humanities cultural institutions all over the D.C. Region! A trip to a theater or museum can positively change a student’s life forever by enhancing his or her creativity, curiosity, and enthusiasm for learning.


With your assistance students will have the opportunity to experience educational prgrams and performances at organizations such as The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, The Kreeger Museum, The National Geographic Museum, The Library of Congress, President Lincoln's Cottage, The Textile Museum, The Washington Bach Consort, The Museum of American History, and The Washington Ballet and many more. Click here for our full member's list.  Without the Arts for Every Student program program, many of the students would not get to experience these amazing cultural institutions.


Washington Performing Arts Society fieldtrip.

 

In praise of the Arts for Every Student Program, the following participants stated:

"The DC Collaborative enables our students to have a world-class arts education.“  -Joanna Lewton, Teacher, Capital City Public Charter School

“When you first walk into the Kennedy Center, it feels like heaven,” -Fifth grade student Tiana

“The students of Anacostia High School have had the privilege to attend amazing educational and cultural events thanks to the DC Collaborative,” -Victoria Bellard, teacher, Anacostia Senior High School.

“These programs have impacted the developmental growth of every child at Key, as well as across the DC Metro area.” -Janis Linden, Kindergarten Teacher, Key Elementary School

“The unique role the DC Collaborative plays is beneficial—not only to the arts and humanities education community – but the city as a whole.” -Nicole Jost, Artistic Director, Young Playwrights’ Theater

“These trips connect to our curriculum and Common Core Standards …and my students LOVE these trips! Please help the DC Collaborative continue providing DC students with such wonderful programming.” -Johanna Janssens, Teacher, Oyster-Adams Elementary School

 

D.C. students deserve a high-quality education, and the arts and humanities are central to a high-quality education where students are encouraged to be innovative, creative and life-long learners. Make a difference in the lives of D.C.’s children today!


Please tell everyone you know and ask them to share with everyone they know. Please post our campaign on Facebook and Twitter and your Website. Donate what you can. Even small amounts add up to a lot of energy, power, and hope.

 

Student on a fieldtrip to the Smithsonian National Museum of African Art.

 

Students on a President Lincoln's Cottage fieldtrip entitled "Lincoln's Hat."  Through this workshop students examine Lincoln's writing style, imitate his writing techniques, take a tour of the cottage where Lincoln lived during most of his presidency, and construct their own stovepipe hats. 

 

All donations are tax deductible to under the 501(c)3 IRS tax code. You will receive a receipt upon donating.

story:
Merhabalar, ismim Zeynep Merve. İstanbul Şehir Üniversitesi Sinema-TV Bölümü'nde araştırma görevlisiyim. Akademik ilgi alanımlarımın başında belgesel yer alıyor. Özetle; belgeselde alternatif anlatılar üzerine hem teorik hem de pratik çalışmalar yapmaya çalışıyorum. 

Mayıs ayı sonunda Edinburgh Üniversitesi'ne yaptığım doktora başvurusunun* olumlu sonuçlandığını öğrendim. 

*Programın tam adı: The University of Edinburgh Trans-Disciplinary Documentary Film PhD 

Edınburgh Üniversitesi'nden ''Edinburgh Global Research Scholarship'' bursunu aldım.

Ancak okula kayıt yaptırabilmem ve en azından bir süre hayatıma orada devam edebilmem için bursa ihtiyacım var. Türkiye'de uzun zamandır beni destekleyebilecek bir kurum/kişi bulmaya çalışıyorum ancak şu ana kadar ne yazık ki olumlu cevap alamadım. 

Arkadaşlarımla birlikte bir video hazırlayıp sesimizi bu şekilde duyurmaya karar verdik. 

''Seni niye destekleyelim ki?'' diye soracak olursanız; 

1) Türkiye'de belgesel alanında doktora ve hatta lisans/yüksek lisans eğitimi alabileceğim bir eğitim kurumu yok.

2) Şimdiye kadar birkaç belgesel film denemem oldu. Son çalışmam; IN OUT öncelikle Cannes Film Festivali olmak üzere pek çok ulusal ve uluslararası film festivalinde gösterildi ve çeşitli ödüller aldı. Bu alanda çalışmalarıma hem teorik hem de pratik anlamda devam etmek istiyorum.

IN OUT- Ödüller

 -       5. Kristal Klaket Kısa Film Yarışması, “En İyi Belgesel”

-       16. Boston Türk Filmleri Festivali- “En İyi Belgesel”

-       İFSAK Film Festivali- “En İyi Belgesel”

-       JCI ISTANBUL CROSSROADS – 6. Uluslararası Kısa Film Festivali- 2.lik Ödülü

-       2. Uluslararası Kral Midas Kısa Film Festivali 3.lük Ödülü

 

IN OUT- Gösterildiği Diğer Festivaller

-       Cannes Film Festivali 2012- Short Film Corner

-       Polonya “European Day for Border Guards 2012”

-       48. Uluslararası Antalya Altın Portakal Film Festivali

-       31. Uluslararası İstanbul Film Festivali

-       15. Uçan Süpürge Uluslararası Kadın Filmleri Festivali

-       Hisar’12 Film Seçkisi

-       10. Filmmor Kadın Filmleri Festivali

-       ODTÜ Film Festivali’12

-       2. Yılmaz Güney Kültür ve Sanat Festivali

-       5. Sinepark Kısa Film Festivali

-       TİHV 2. İnsan Hakları Belgesel Film Günleri

-       2. Uluslararası Gençlik Filmleri Festivali

-       2. Uluslararası Dersim Film Festivali

-       Varşova Türk Filmleri Haftası




Bana yardımcı olursanız çok mutlu olurum.

 

Teşekkürler,

merve

story:
"The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches, but reveal to them their own." --Disraeli

 

In December of 2010, THUNK, Northwestern University's first acapella group, took its fourth trip to Cape Town, South Africa to hold music education workshops for children and perform at several concert venues to raise money for youth affected by the HIV/AIDS epidemic.

This upcoming December, Thunk hopes to continue the tradition with Cape Town Project 2012. The Project will cost $40,000. It is not funded through the University and therefore will require the utmost efforts and contributions from Thunk's 17 current members. This money will go directly towards funding the trip itself as far as transportation, food, and lodging. We have set our goals with indiegogo at $5,000, but the costs are so high that any amount that we raise will be greatly appreciated. If, for some reason, we don't reach our goals on indiegogo, the missing funds will be supplemented by further fundraising on campus. No matter what, we are making this trip happen!

If successful, Thunk will be able to accomplish this year's incredible project of musical outreach and civic engagement to open up music for these children as a means of discovering their limitless potential, gaining confidence, and expressing themselves through the medium of music. Each of us has been so fortunate in the opportunities that we have been given and sincerely feel it necessary that we do whatever is in our power to give back.

If you want to learn more about THUNK, our members, and what we do on campus, visit: http://thunkacappella.weebly.com/

story:
Hi everyone, 

   My name is Carrie. I met Yonas while I lived in Addis Abba, Ethiopia for 5 months in early 2011 while I was finalizing the adoption of my daughter. We became close thru continued email correspondance and letters. I also made multiple trips back to Addis with my work and would meet daily with him during those trips. I can truly say this boy is gifted and driven. He wants to be a doctor, and to help ease suffering not just in his own country but the world! I have often wondered what he might cure or whom he may help in the future if given that chance. So I am trying to provide that opportunity for him now.

THE FORK IN THE ROAD:

My family and I originally tried to host Yonas on an educational visa. The US embassy denied Yonas the educational visa on November 19 based on his orphan status, even though they told me in June this would not be a problem. The Journey now is headed down the path of adoption. All funds raised will be used for Yonas and his continued journey home.

We will NOT give up on this boy. 

 

*************** ADOPTION FEE BREAKDOWN*********************** 

Here is the breakdown of how the $16,000 will be spent now..... below, in the chart, are the fees for the adoption agency. It does not include the homestudy, or immigration fees which are additional $3000. 

1st Agency Fee

$2,500

2nd Agency fee

$2,500

Dossier Authentication

$525

Home Study Review

$300

Post Adoption Liability (refundable)

$300

Ethiopia Country Fee

$8,200

In Country Fee

$700

Validation Fee (refundable)

$300

 

TOTAL

 

$15,575

 

 

 

********* We will cover the cost of all the gifts and mailing fees***************

 

You can also help us by spreading the word thru your FB page, twitter, and email blasts !

 

Thank you for helping us to help him. I am heartbroken with the latest snag with the embassy but I am determined, and will not leave him behind.

Sincerely,

C.

story:
Our school needs a home.

Please help the Daylesford Dharma School and our 60 students build a new school.

Our children are our hope for the future.

We’re a 7-year-old independent school with 60 primary students and more to come.

We’re ready to open our secondary school but we’ve struck a major setback.

Our lease has run out and we have to build a new home for our school in a matter of months.

We have found the perfect site – a beautiful, sloping field on the edge of Wombat Hill in Daylesford. Now we need to raise the money to buy it.

We can’t do it alone.

We need your support to grow our school, to help us buy the land and build a new school to teach the wise and compassionate leaders of tomorrow.

By giving, you provide the promise of something bigger than land, more important than just another school. By giving you are contributing to a better future for our children and the world around us.

$900,000 Stretch Goals.

$450,000 will buy our land.

$650,000 will buy the land and let us relocate our existing two classrooms.

$900,000 will buy the land and help us build a new classroom.

Please help us. Please give. Please help us make a difference.

Why Give?

  • If the way of the world doesn’t change here, then where?
  • If wisdom and compassion are not learnt now, then when?
  • If we can’t save our planet with loving kindness, then how?
  • If our children are not the hope for humanity, then who?

We’re here to make a difference.

Daylesford Dharma School is here to make a difference.

Why the Dharma School is important.

Our children are our future. They are the hope of humanity as the challenges that face us around the world continue to escalate. These challenges call for a new kind of humanity and a new kind of leadership - one that is not based on power and will alone. But a humanity that is guided by the enduring qualities of wisdom and compassion. These are the qualities that lead to right action. One-pointed and altruistic, with the highest good as our goal.

Over time we are seeing a new kind of child emerge at the school. One who adopts an attitude of open-heartedness.

Who chooses to act from a clear sense of what is right.
Who is learning to master conflict resolution. Who considers their impact on the world around them. Who is guided to seek the highest good for all.

We believe the world needs more children like this, children who will grow into adults with values and qualities than can make a true difference. Loving parents,
compassionate leaders, benevolent business operators, caring workers, wise teachers, truthful politicians, true peace makers.

This is why the Daylesford Dharma School is important

Please give generously.



About our fundraising

Daylesford Dharma School is an Australian Not For Profit with Deductible Gift Recipient status from the Australian Tax Office for the building of our new school. Any contributions made by you which do not have a 'perk' attached can be claimed as a deduction on your income tax. Once the campaign completes we will send Australian residents who have kindly donated a tax deductible receipt.

History of the Dharma School

The Daylesford Dharma School started as an inspiration from Geshe Konchok Tsering to his student Andrea Furness. She had requested advice about taking on a project in Mongolia or providing support for Buddhist nuns. Instead he challenged her to take on a bigger view that would be of greater benefit - start a Buddhist primary school here in her home town of Daylesford. Within 3 years and with a dedication effort that included many supporters,  Andrea opened the doors for the Dharma School's first intake of students in 2009. Fifteen eager children between the ages of 5 and 9 sat on the floor in the refurbished Daylesford  tennis club rooms,  with our first wonderful teacher Lynda.

Today in 2015 we are 60 students from prep to year 6, 4 classrooms, 12 dedicated staff, a kitchen garden and a nurturing learning environment. We are a school community immersed in leaning and growing awareness in young minds and hearts.

Ways you can help

By giving generously you can help us secure the future of the school. You can also help by sharing this campaign with family friends and those who care. These people may not be Buddhist, nor have school age children. They may be people who understand that an education informed by compassion, kindness and mindful consumption will make a difference to our future. 

They are people who say; "imagine if I had an education like this, imagine what my potential could be now. Imagine what the world would look like." By giving generously to this campaign you will help to make this future possible. 

FAQs

Can I donate from outside Australia? 

Yes you can!  You can pay via Paypal however note that tax deductibility is only for eligible Australian residents and there are additional shipping costs.
Please note that contributions made from non-Australia residents are not eligible for tax deductible receipts.

Not-for-profit / Tax deductable contributions

Any contributions you make to our school fund are eligible to receive a tax deductible receipt. This only applies to Australian residents and there are guidelines for tax deductible receipts. 

If you are an Australian resident and wish to receive a tax deductable receipt, please either:

  • choose a Perk (non tax deductible) and add a further contribution during the payment process (tax deductible)
  • choose to only give a contribution  (tax deductible)

Once the campaign completes you will receive a tax deductible receipt for the relevant amount.

Payments

Its easy.  Simply follow the prompts and use your credit card or Paypal account to make your contribution. 

Large contributions

For contributions greater than $10,000 please contact us at fundraising@dharmaschool.com.au so we can assist you.

Shipping

Shipping within Australia is included in the perk amount. 

International shipping

To cover the additional costs for international shipping we have included an amount in the perk description. 

More questions?

Need more information?  Contact us fundraising@dharmaschool.com.au

Perks

We would love to share a little bit of the Dharma Schools with you by offering perks that align with our principles. 

$250 - Food with love

At the Daylesford Dharma School, the children are taught the principle of 'non harm' toward all living beings. Through our precept of Mindful Consumption the students are made more aware of where their food comes from and the impact that it has on our environment.

Choose this contribution level and receive a vegan cookbook to bring inspiration, awareness and love into your kitchen.


$2,500 - Laughter is the best medicine

Comedy 4 Karma began in 2014 with some of Australia's best comedic talents ascending on Daylesford to raise money for the school.

By choosing this contribution you and one other will enjoy front row seats, meet the talent and enjoy some of Daylesford's fine food offerings. 

Comedy 4 Karma will be happening in Daylesford on 17 October 2015, with the brilliant line-up to be announced soon.


$1,000 - Prayer for peace

Contribute $1000 and receive a hand decorated set of prayer flags by the students of  Daylesford Dharma School.


$150 - Sitting in perfection

Contribute $150 and receive a handmade origami lotus flower made by the students of Daylesford Dharma School.


$50 - Help carry the dream
Contribute $50 and receive a calico bag with the Daylesford Dharma School logo printed onto it.


$25 - Picture our future
We will send you a postcard decorated by a student as a thank you. 


$10,000 Deep abiding gratitude

Handmade book of gratitude featuring drawings, poems, muddy hand prints, photos and lots of love!
story_txt:
Our school needs a home.
Please help the Daylesford Dharma School and our 60 students build a new school.Our children are our hope for the future.
We’re a 7-year-old independent school with 60 primary students and more to come.We’re ready to open our secondary school but we’ve struck a major setback.
Our lease has run out and we have to build a new home for our school in a matter of months.We have found the perfect site – a beautiful, sloping field on the edge of Wombat Hill in Daylesford. Now we need to raise the money to buy it.We can’t do it alone.
We need your support to grow our school, to help us buy the land and build a new school to teach the wise and compassionate leaders of tomorrow.
By giving, you provide the promise of something bigger than land, more important than just another school. By giving you are contributing to a better future for our children and the world around us.
$900,000 Stretch Goals.
$450,000 will buy our land. 
$650,000 will buy the land and let us relocate our existing two classrooms.
$900,000 will buy the land and help us build a new classroom.
Please help us. Please give. Please help us make a difference.



Why Give?


If the way of the world doesn’t change here, then where?

If wisdom and compassion are not learnt now, then when?
If we can’t save our planet with loving kindness, then how?
If our children are not the hope for humanity, then who?


We’re here to make a difference.
Daylesford Dharma School is here to make a difference.

Why the Dharma School is important.
Our children are our future. They are the hope of humanity as the challenges that face us around the world continue to escalate. These challenges call for a new kind of humanity and a new kind of leadership - one that is not based on power and will alone. But a humanity that is guided by the enduring qualities of wisdom and compassion. These are the qualities that lead to right action. One-pointed and altruistic, with the highest good as our goal.Over time we are seeing a new kind of child emerge at the school. One who adopts an attitude of open-heartedness.Who chooses to act from a clear sense of what is right.Who is learning to master conflict resolution. Who considers their impact on the world around them. Who is guided to seek the highest good for all.We believe the world needs more children like this, children who will grow into adults with values and qualities than can make a true difference. Loving parents,compassionate leaders, benevolent business operators, caring workers, wise teachers, truthful politicians, true peace makers.This is why the Daylesford Dharma School is important

Please give generously.

story:
We Can’t Do It Alone- We Need YOU!


Urban Ed Academy SMART Saturdays: 

STUDY --- MOVE --- ACHIEVE --- RESPOND --- TRANSITION 

We are reminded of the failures and shortfalls of our systems and communities everyday. Too many of our young men find themselves on the fringes of American society simply because they lack a solid educational and social foundation. As a result, boys are 30% more likely than girls to drop out of school and a high school drop out is ineligible for 90% of jobs in America. 

The Urban Ed Academy SMART Saturdays program is changing this pattern. 
Jonathan was a fourth grader reading at a second grade level. His reading and science scores placed him at the bottom 25th percentile of students in his grade. He spent more time in the principal’s office than the classroom. Like so many other boys, he was on a dangerous trajectory. A child with little or no connection to school becomes a high school dropout, who is likely to be out of work, living in poverty, or worse. If he is a young man of color, he is more likely to go to prison instead of college. We know this and it can seem so hopeless, but it’s not.

There are solutions! SMART Saturdays is helping Jonathan. He is now reading at his appropriate grade level,  excited about learning and has an interest in engineering. 

Urban Ed Academy is an organization that is helping hundreds of boys just like Jonathan, find the support they need to succeed in school and in life. 

What Is Urban Ed Academy?

Urban Ed Academy (UEA) is a 501(c)3 non profit organization that offers year round educational enhancement opportunities to 250 third, fourth and fifth grade boys on Saturdays and throughout the academic term. The innovative strategies of the SMART program builds academic proficiency and targets areas identified as most critical for the academic success of boys.

Math and literacy are the “gatekeepers of citizenship” and the deadline for learning is alarmingly early. A U.S. Department of Education study concluded that students without appropriate math and reading skills by the sixth grade are unlikely to acquire them by the end of high school. 

SMART Saturdays offsets the 200 educational hours lost due to absenteeism and disciplinary action, and transforms young boys, between seven and ten years years of age, into eager learners who are ready to excel. SMART Saturdays provides a culturally relevant curriculum over 42 Saturdays each year to bring an additional 330 hours of learning to each boy’s educational experience. 

Opportunity to Make Real Change

 UEA needs to raise $10,000 by September 12, 2015 which is the start of the school year.Reaching our goal of $10,000 will enable UEA to continue to achieve success and meet the educational needs these young boys. 

Every dollar you give directly impacts each UEA child.

Make Academic Success the Norm

96% of boys who attend Urban Ed Academy earn better grades, have better attendance records and encounter fewer disciplinary actions.

Results of our 2014-2015 sessions :

  • School Attendance Increased by 67%
  • School Disciplinary Actions Decreased 78
  • Core Academic Competencies Increased 82%

UEA’s strategies allow youth to build on assets and provide opportunities for them to act as partners and leaders. UEA is committed to developing strong youth-adult relationships at home and in school.

Help Give these Amazing Young Boys a Fair Shot There's only a few weeks before the new school year starts. We need  your help to continue this important work. Please help us by posting the link to this campaign to your social media pages or forwarding it to friends using the hashtag #UEASmart. From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you.

story:
THE BLASPHEMY LAW PROJECT

Engage is a nonprofit  research and advocacy organization working on Pakistan’s blasphemy law. The mass support for this narrative makes it  a potent legal instrument for intimidation, violence and enacting personal vendettas, and specific persecution of minorities.  We are attempting to deconstruct the law and its surrounding social narrative through the framework that informs it--the first attempt of its kind. Please take the time to go through the rest of our profile and the introductory video above which summarizes the problem and how we propose to address it.

The Law

The law (section 295-C of Pakistan Penal Code) holds that anyone convicted of the offense of blasphemy against the prophet Muhammad is to be awarded a fixed death penalty, with no possibility of a pardon or waiver.

            1. Impact of the Problem

Mobs rampaged through the Joseph Colony neighbourhood of Lahore in March last year after blasphemy allegations against Sawan Masih emerged. —AFP

1.1. Exponential Increase in Blasphemy Accusations

Angry Pakistani demonstrators torch Christian's belongings during a protest over a blasphemy row in a Christian. 

1.2. The Impact: Increase in Accusations by 17,500%

Since the introduction of the more stringent form of the law, blasphemy accusations increased by around 17500 %. This staggering increase in the number of individuals accused of the offence shows that the law has been used as a tool of persecution and oppression. People did not simply become dramatically more 'blasphemous'. Rather, these numbers show that the blasphemy law has been understood to be a viable legal means to target groups and individuals, and has been used as such.

Alleged blasphemy: Mob burns scores of Christian homes in Lahore – The Express Tribune

1.3. The Impact: Increase in Vigilante Violence by 2750%

 The social narrative attached to the perception of blasphemy, and perpetuated by the law, has resulted in an increase in extra-judicial or vigilante killings, by 2750%.  

Couple Beaten, Burned By Mob For Alleged Blasphemy

1.4. The Impact:  Persecution of Religious Minorities

Disproportionate number of cases registered particularly against religious minorities, that represent a small percentage of the total population, fostering a climate of extreme religious intolerance in the region.

2. Defining the Problem

2.1. Perception of the Law as Divine

The law has gathered mass support through its conceptualization as a divine decree that cannot be tampered with. The strength of this law is rooted in this conviction as well as the perpetual promotion of this idea through legal and socio-political institutions of religious authority.

3. Solving the Problem

4. Why us?

4.1. Why previous attempt at reform have failed

4.2. How are we different?

   5. What are you funding?   

Fatwa Drive

Local: Going to every major Madrassah (Seminary) and collecting Fatwas (Legal Opinion) and traditional texts that state the authentic Hanafi stance and echo our findings. This includes community-level dissemination of these fatwas to prayer leaders of local mosques.

International:  A similar fatwa collection campaign from authoritative fatwa-issuing institutions around the world.

Workshops

De-radicalization workshops in major colleges and universities by traditional ulama (clerics) over the first 6 months.

Workshops with other non-profit organizations and activist groups highlighting the need to engage through culturally relevant frameworks.

Legal Handbook

Improving quality of legal counsel available to those charged under the blasphemy law by publishing a legal guidebook for advocates defending them. 

Library

Establishing a comprehensive library of modern and classical texts that further clarifies and solidifies the intellectual foundations of our narrative. Commission translation of these works from Arabic to Urdu.

Establishing Research Wing:

Ongoing research into the historical and political context of the law for developing informed strategies for countering radical narratives through a team of dedicated and qualified research personnel.

Regularly publishing research geared towards academic circles, to stimulate further independent inquiry into the subject.

To frame and present research for the layperson via well regarded local as well as international media.

                 6. WHO ARE WE?

Our core team consists of religious academics, lawyers, a psychologist and development sector professionals. Through our advisory panel, we have access to a diverse network of resources, from orthodox ulama from across Pakistan to progressive scholars and academics around the globe. 

7. WHAT HAVE WE DONE SO FAR?

  • Groundbreaking research that uncovers factual inaccuracies in the foundation of the law
  • Research presented at:
  • "IAS-LUMS Conference - New Horizons in Islamic Area Studies: Encounters, Reflections & Collaborations" - Lahore, Pakistan, Organized by NIHU Program for Islamic Area Studies, Waseda University. November 2nd-4th, 2013
  • "Freedom of religion and expression in the Islamic tradition" - Istanbul, Turkey organized by Oslo Coalition on Freedom of Religion or Belief, University of Oslo. August 22nd-24th, 2014
  • Research being published by Norwegian Center for Human Rights 
  • An ongoing five part series "The Untold Story of Pakistan's Blasphemy Law" published by a leading news daily (Dawn.com).
  • The Untold Story of Pakistan's Blasphemy Law
  • The fatwa that can change Pakistan's blasphemy narrative
  • The Politics of Pakistan's Blasphemy Law
  • Work commended by Nicholas Kristoff in New York Times
  • Our team advised Justice Project Pakistan (a non profit organization)  on a Supreme Court blasphemy case.

8. Long Term Vision

  • Creating space for dialogue and debate, strategically engaging all stakeholders working towards a society where the minority segment are not systemically targeted using Legal Devices or Religious Instruments.
  • Countering the increasingly radical impact of “Otherising” narratives.
  • Limiting the influence of attempts to encroach upon the values of an integrated society through Research, Dialogue and Reform. 
For queries please contact arafat@engagepakistan.com

story:
This upcoming fall, Marc Pierre will be attending Harvard Business School and Jerry Petit-Frere will be attending the Johnson School of Business at Cornell University. We have both traveled on multiple mission trips to Haiti in previous years.  In the summer of 2011, Marc led a business seminar to a group of up to 60 youth in the Leogane area of Haiti teaching them how to create business plans and launch start up enterprises.  Jerry led a marketing seminar teaching the youth the essential elements of business marketing and the importance of proper customer service.  The picture above was taken during our mission trip to Leogane, Haiti last year.

Prior to enrolling in business school this fall, we will be traveling to China on a two week trip with The MBADiversity Organization (www.mbadiversity.org).  MBADiversity Global Immersion Module (GIM) is the international module that fosters global awareness for future change agents.  We are only two of a small group of eight MBA candidates that were chosen for this year's program, which will be in China.  The primary goal of this trip is to strengthen our leadership development, service and global awareness acumen prior to beginning our MBA programs.  

The total cost of the trip is $8,000.  We would love to raise enough to cover 100% of this cost, however our goal is to raise a minimum of 50%. We both hope to use our MBAs to make a positive impact in the international community whether through business or education.  We trust that our trip to China will be a positive step into helping us realize the mission God has for us.  

We appreciate all donations towards our cause.  We truly thank you for all your support.

 

God bless,

 

Marc and Jerry
story_txt:
This upcoming fall, Marc Pierre will be attending Harvard Business School and Jerry Petit-Frere will be attending the Johnson School of Business at Cornell University. We have both traveled on multiple mission trips to Haiti in previous years.  In the summer of 2011, Marc led a business seminar to a group of up to 60 youth in the Leogane area of Haiti teaching them how to create business plans and launch start up enterprises.  Jerry led a marketing seminar teaching the youth the essential elements of business marketing and the importance of proper customer service.  The picture above was taken during our mission trip to Leogane, Haiti last year.
Prior to enrolling in business school this fall, we will be traveling to China on a two week trip with The MBADiversity Organization (www.mbadiversity.org).  MBADiversity Global Immersion Module (GIM) is the international module that fosters global awareness for future change agents.  We are only two of a small group of eight MBA candidates that were chosen for this year's program, which will be in China.  The primary goal of this trip is to strengthen our leadership development, service and global awareness acumen prior to beginning our MBA programs.  
The total cost of the trip is $8,000.  We would love to raise enough to cover 100% of this cost, however our goal is to raise a minimum of 50%. We both hope to use our MBAs to make a positive impact in the international community whether through business or education.  We trust that our trip to China will be a positive step into helping us realize the mission God has for us.  
We appreciate all donations towards our cause.  We truly thank you for all your support.
 
God bless,
 
Marc and Jerry

story:
The problem: In Ghana, over 60% of junior high school students are unable to pass their high school entrance exam. That means these kids are unable to receive any further education. Those that do pass often have to drop out of High School prematurely because of their inability to afford their high school fees ($15 USD per trimester). If they do graduate most students can’t possibly afford to continue on to University. We now know that education does not just affect those who receive it; it also ripples out to affect an entire community.

Exponential Education has found a way to help all three levels of school children in Ghana to succeed and advance their education. In each community that hosts one of our programs work, five high-achieving high school students are selected to tutor five junior high students who are struggling to pass their exit exams. Those high school students receive a stipend to help them pay their school expenses and the junior high students get the help they need to pass their exams so they can continue on to high school. The high school students also have the opportunity to earn a university scholarship. Currently, we work in 25 locations throughout Ghana that are helping nearly 750 students achieve their educational goals and improve their prospects for a more fulfilling life—not to mention their potential for helping others to do the same.

In an exciting new initiative, we have recently partnered with the Peace Corps to expand our tutoring programs in the Upper West, Western, and Eastern regions of Ghana. We are seeking funding for Peace Corps volunteers as well as our program associates to institute the Exponential Education tutoring system in new areas and give more students a chance for a better education and a better life. Please help us make a crucial change not only in the lives of our students but also in the communities hosting our programs through this exciting new partnership with the Peace Corps and our new volunteers. Your donation will change lives in Ghana and as a result, it might just change yours as well.

This campaign will support the programs of Summer Wheeler, Dara Denney and Jessica Keaton. All funds raised will directly support their programs and initiatives at Exponential Education, and any remaining funding will be used for future Exponential Education programs.

story:
About me

My name is Cathy Paquette, author of "The Treasures of Special Needs Parenting: Tips and Strategy Gems".  I am a mother of three wonderful and challenging children.  Two have ADD and were tested as gifted. This presented an unusual
situation for the schools who were prepared with gifted programs to challenge them but did not have the training or resources within those programs to deal with the obstacles of Attention Deficit Disorder that stand in the way of that child being able to tap those gifts.  For that they needed to attend Special Needs programs which did not address the gifted needs.

My third and most challenging child has Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity (ADHD) combined with Conduct Disorder, Oppositional Defiance Disorder and
Depression.  He provided the extreme sport in the family….Extreme stress…extreme frustration…extreme joy…extreme love…extreme exhaustion…extreme fear for his
future….

I also grew up with oppositional defiance disorder (don’t tell me no!)and depression.
Unfortunately there wasn’t much understanding for those kinds of children or
special services at that time, but some of the skills that they used are still practiced today. While these special needs can create obstacles parenting these special children, I believe that they gave me a unique insight into their behaviours and contributed to our success.

Why I created the book?

While these special needs can create parenting obstacles, I whole heartily believe
that there are ways to manage and successfully overcome the challenges faced by
special needs families that celebrate their uniqueness without highlighting the
social stigma associated with special needs. 

In response to other special needs parents’ demands, I wrote an book entitled, “The
Treasures of Special Needs Parenting – Tips and Strategy Gems” that shows
parents how to efficiently and successfully navigate the complex Canadian and
Provincial educational systems for special needs children as well as parenting
strategies that focus on each special child’s “treasure”, or uniquely endearing
qualities. 

I created this book to provide families like mine with tips and strategies to help them to review their own situation,  and create a plan of action that will bring them a sense of hope.

 

Why I need your help?

Currently, the book exists in electronic format and is in need of publishing in hard copy format to enable each client to use as a workbook.  The eBook has the professional support of a locally prominent physician that is a member of the Children’s Hospital team of doctors that specialize in treating ASD, ADD and ADHD children.

"I know of no other book that offers the type of support we have here for families and their special needs children with ADHD and children in the autism spectrum.  They will now have the tools to be advocates for their children, and learn from the author's strategies that helped her through difficult times with her own son.  This book should be a must, not only for families but professionals dealing with these high needs youngsters." - Dr. William James, M.D., FRCPCC

After much research, no other product exists in the market that provides the level of aid and information to parents of special needs children.  This why I need your help. I am looking to print 1000 copies to be sent to clinics at the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario, Child and Youth Services such as the Crossroads Children's Centre, and other various Healthcare agencies and services.  I also want to make the book available to the individual families for a small fee.

Your contribution will allow my dream of helping other parents and professionals working with families to come true.

story:
We're disabled artisans in Nepal asking for your support to help us get our online business up and running.  We are skilled producers of fine traditional products, but we're disabled and this means it's difficult to find work in spite of our excellent craftsmanship.  We want to help ourselves  so we’ve set up an online business which 1) sells our crafts, and 2) offers a bespoke design service for gift packaging.  Please help us make it a success!

www.tarascraft.com


Our business

There are two sides to our business: (www.tarascraft.com)

1 – we sell our crafts online

2 – we offer a bespoke design service for gift packaging.  We use gorgeous materials, including sustainably produced Lokta paper, bhutanese cloth, paper made from grasses and bamboo, cottons, linens, wood, bone and horn.  We make bags and boxes of every description, hand-turned buttons, notebooks and picture frames.

Who we are

Tarascraft is self-help group of people with disabilities in Kathmandu, Nepal.  We are skilled artisans, making fine traditional products from sustainably produced materials.   Our disabilities mean that it’s hard to get work and meet even our most basic needs.  We don’t want poverty, and we don’t want to be reliant on external aid.  Please help us become independent and successful in our small way.

Tarascraft was set up by Taranath Sigdel (Tara) who was ostracised from his village at the age of eleven because of a disability.  He was lucky: he found a doctor who treated his condition, and now Tara has a BA in Business Studies and seven years experience of quality control in the handcrafts sector in Nepal.  He is determined to help other disabled artisans gain employment by working as a group in Tarascraft.

Tara and his family

Dr Fran Giaquinto is the link for Tarascraft in Europe.  She met Tara four years ago when travelling in Nepal.  Fran is a botanist and lives in an ecohouse on the west of Ireland where she teaches people about ecology and native plants, and how they can be used for health and wellbeing.  She was Taracraft’s first customer, continues to be a strong advocate for their products, and supports what Tara aims to achieve.

Fran Giaquinto


Co-worker at Tarascraft

Co-worker at Tarascraft


What Tarascraft has achieved so far: -

Our website – www.tarascraft.com - is up and running, but we require funds to manage the website, maintain the online catalogue and set up an online payment system.

We have an online catalogue offering 54 items.  We plan to increase to 100 items, and change our products regularly so that we always have a range of interesting and new products.

So far, we’ve had a few customers who have used our design service and they are very happy with our products.  Now we need more customers!

What we need

We’re asking for your support to:

·  get the website fully operational ($500 for 2 years)

·  improve our working conditions ($1000)

·  A laptop ($500) At the moment we are dependent on internet cafes

·  Marketing (€1000) to help promote our products and online business in USA, Europe and elsewhere

·  Cash flow for stock, wages, packaging and sending items ($500)

Yes, we are seeking financial help to get the website fully operational, buy stock and improve our working conditions.  But we would love help in kind just as much.  We will be very grateful if you can offer us your skills in design and marketing, or you have equipment that would help us as people with disabilities.

Our philosophy

We make beautiful, durable products that do not harm the earth.  The materials we use are sustainably produced and hand-made.  For example, Lokta is a shrub that is sustainably produced in the Nepal mountains, and Lokta paper-production is an important industry for rural people. 

We want to improve the quality of our lives.  If we can make our business successful, we will benefit ourselves, our families and many other disabled people.  We hope to develop a model sustainable business that other disabled people can replicate elsewhere. 

Nepal is a very poor country and getting poorer.  If we can help ourselves, we can help others.  Your support will go a very long way.

We are transparent and honest in all that we do. We guarantee our absolute best.


How you can contribute

·  Financial donations: even small amounts go a long way in Nepal

·  Contribute your skills: we need help to design products that are unusual, sophisticated and beautiful

·  Spread the word about our campaign! 

·  Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Here are some of the products our customers have asked us to make

Here are some of our Lokta papers

Please check out our website for our many other products!

www.tarascraft.com

Thankyou for meeting us!

contribute

story:
I am a first grade teacher in a poverty-stricken school in New Orleans.

My first graders are truly incredible little people who face challenges in their day to day lives that I still struggle to comprehend. When I moved to New Orleans nearly three years ago to teach elementary school, I knew that I was going to have an impact on my students. What I didn't realize was the impact that they would, in turn, have on me. Despite problems at home and in their neighborhoods, they come to school every day, and it is my number one goal to create a classroom environment where everyone belongs and feels welcome.

Because of them, I frequently work 12-13 hour days, plus weekends. Because of them, I strive to make myself a better person capable of empathy, compassion, and patience. They learn a lot in school, not just about academics, but about how to get along, work together, and be a family.

I want them to be exposed to even more, however, and that's where Teddy Bear Tea comes in. Last year, I was fortunate enough to take two of my girls to Teddy Bear Tea, along with some other students and teachers at my school. We all had the time of our lives as we ate sweets, drank hot chocolate, and met with Santa, Mrs. Claus, and Rudolph. As each girl received her own teddy bear for attending, one exclaimed, "I can't WAIT to come back next year!" This same teacher and I decided that instead of taking only 1-2 girls to tea this year, we want to take ALL of the girls in our classes!

This year, I want to give all ten girls in my class a magical Teddy Bear Tea experience. The event, however, is expensive for a teacher on a limited budget. I need $1300 for tickets for my girls, chaperones, and transportation to and from the event.

About Teddy Bear Tea

Teddy Bear Tea is a lovely event held in a fancy New Orleans hotel. The lobby is draped in thousands of white Christmas lights, and every inch of space is transformed into a beautiful winter wonderland. The tea ballroom looks like a scene from Santa's workshop, and characters like Santa, Mrs. Claus, and Rudolph move through the crowd, take pictures, and even read stories to the children. There is even a fun New Orleans tradition - a Second Line - led by a real trumpeter as children and their families dance among the tables. As the children leave, they are each given a teddy bear to remember a truly magical day.

Teddy Bear Tea means...

By donating to my project, you would be giving my first grade girls the experience of a lifetime, something that they would never be able to experience otherwise. I wish I had the means to provide experiences like this all by myself, but with your generous donations, my students will want for nothing this Christmas. My girls and I thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

story:
Short Summary

Who we are:

Hello! we are Integrate Tech, a startup that is dedicated to innovation and customer satisfaction. Our mission is to become the new standard for education by creating affordable products that redefine the user experience and streamlining the learning process. We are a humble team of passionate innovators who truly want to make a difference. 

The Problem:

Education in the United States is improving but there is still much progress to be made. The problem is that the technology that is currently used in the classroom is very distracting for students, as they can exit out of applications at any time. The programs currently used in schools are fragmented, which creates an inefficient environment. Lastly, students are assigned work that is not individualized for each student’s needs. Integrate Tech seeks to resolve these pressing issues in a manner that is beneficial to nearly all socioeconomic groups.  

Our Solution:

We intend to solve these problems with our Integrate education technology software, which is intended to consolidate all programs that are used in education, while completely blocking out all outside distractions. There are three levels of access to information: Administrator, Teacher, and Student. Administration has master access to all data and can control which add-on features are accessible for the teacher's use. Teachers have the ability to limit the student's access to non-academic applications in real time. The heart of our software is the smart agenda which changes the environment based on the user’s class schedule.  When class begins, the teacher's screen will display class management features of the current class section, while students can only access appropriate applications and personal notes to the class they are currently in. Teachers will be able to seamlessly take attendance while teaching class, have easy lesson plan builders that adheres to the standards of their schools district, and will have access to a teacher sharing network. Integrate will also allow for third party content integration for programs that do not come standard. Integrate creates an educational environment that can be molded to each school’s needs, while having a sleek and user friendly user interface. 

The features that make us unique are:

  • seamless integration of all important educational applications into one easy to use platform
  • blocking out all outside distractions – even the ability to exit the program during class time
  • state of the art artificial intelligence to provide a customizable learning experience for students and data analytics for educators. 
Our vision is to streamline the learning process and become the new standard for education. 


We Are Featured In:

http://businessinnovatorsmagazine.com/kevin-celisca-business-leader-interview/

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $2,500 for development of our Alpha product. 100% of the funds will be going into development whether we reach our goal or not! 

There are three different perk levels: 

Thank You! ($10) - We will send you an Email thanking you for your generous contribution :) 

Business Advice ($200) - If you would would be interested in getting business advice, we would be happy to help! On top of both of Max and Kevin helping start successful companies; We have a vast network of friends who are entrepreneurs, developers, lawyers, and more!

Dinner With the Founders ($500) - Your contribution is amazing and greatly appreciated. We would be more than happy to meet and go out for dinner for a night of fun! 


The Impact

By donating, you will be a part of a revolution that has the potential to redefine education in America forever. To show our appreciation, our company Integrate will offer significantly reduced rates for the first schools looking to pilot the program. 


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is working on Integrate full-time while having personal expenses. We are overcoming  this by freelancing while working on our projects as much as we can. This is why funding is so crucial!

We know we will be successful because:

Maxwell Witt Is the apprentice to Gerard Adams (Millennial Thought Leader, Serial Entrepreneur, and Angel Investor) who co-founded Elite Daily. Recently he helped start a non-profit called Fownders.

Kevin Celisca worked for EY and started a successful Non-Profit called CollegeLingual. 

Emmanuel Johnson is a PhD candidate of Artificial Intelligence and has interned for NASA. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that not everyone can donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help! If you like us please share us on your social media with your friends and spread the word so we can revolutionize the education system together! We can't do it without you!

Integrate creates an educational environment that can be molded to each school’s needs, while having a sleek and user friendly user interface. 
The features that make us unique are:


seamless integration of all important educational applications into one easy to use platform
blocking out all outside distractions – even the ability to exit the program during class time
state of the art artificial intelligence to provide a customizable learning experience for students and data analytics for educators. 

Our vision is to streamline the learning process and become the new standard for education. 




We Are Featured In:


http://businessinnovatorsmagazine.com/kevin-celisca-business-leader-interview/
  What We Need & What You Get We are looking to raise $2,500 for development of our Alpha product. 100% of the funds will be going into development whether we reach our goal or not! 
There are three different perk levels: 
Thank You! ($10) - We will send you an Email thanking you for your generous contribution :) 
Business Advice ($200) - If you would would be interested in getting business advice, we would be happy to help! On top of both of Max and Kevin helping start successful companies; We have a vast network of friends who are entrepreneurs, developers, lawyers, and more!
Dinner With the Founders ($500) - Your contribution is amazing and greatly appreciated. We would be more than happy to meet and go out for dinner for a night of fun! 
   The Impact By donating, you will be a part of a revolution that has the potential to redefine education in America forever. To show our appreciation, our company Integrate will offer significantly reduced rates for the first schools looking to pilot the program. 

    Risks & Challenges Our biggest challenge is working on Integrate full-time while having personal expenses. We are overcoming  this by freelancing while working on our projects as much as we can. This is why funding is so crucial!

We know we will be successful because:
Maxwell Witt Is the apprentice to Gerard Adams (Millennial Thought Leader, Serial Entrepreneur, and Angel Investor) who co-founded Elite Daily. Recently he helped start a non-profit called Fownders.
Kevin Celisca worked for EY and started a successful Non-Profit called CollegeLingual. 
Emmanuel Johnson is a PhD candidate of Artificial Intelligence and has interned for NASA. 

    Other Ways You Can Help We completely understand that not everyone can donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help! If you like us please share us on your social media with your friends and spread the word so we can revolutionize the education system together! We can't do it without you!

story:
Thanks everyone for your generous support! We have reached the $1000 mark, meaning we will have enough to pay for registration and basic robot parts. Our stretch goal is $1500, so we can build a competitive robot that can accomplish tasks autonomously!


Who We Are

TAMSformers Robotics is a student-led organization based at the Texas Academy of Mathematics and Science (TAMS). Each year we participate in the FIRST Robotics Competition (FRC), in which high school students build a robot under professional mentorship. Composed of 28 students (9 female, 19 male; 8 seniors, 20 juniors), our team strives to foster an interest in STEM within our school and our community. 

FIRST Robotics Competition

Last year was our second year competing on the FIRST Robotics Competition, and through the help of mentors and supporters, we were able to qualify for the World Championship, making us the first club team in our school's history to travel outside the state of Texas.

Giving Back

All of our TAMSformers are deeply involved in serving our local community. This past summer, we hosted our first summer camp called "Science Adventure" for 40 kids where we taught them how to program robots, construct circuits, and create chemical reactions. Additionally, we conduct weekly "SciDemos," where we go to different elementary schools to teach kids simple and fun experiments.

Your Support

This year we have continued our efforts in the community, and are planning to compete in FIRST Robotics once again. Money, however, is tight for our team, and your support would help us purchase parts for our robot, buy supplies for community service, pay for competition registration, and cover transportation costs. We have a very dedicated,  very excited team who is really looking forward to competing and your support will help us be successful! 


Funding Goals

$1000: Sustainability - Covers our registration and basic robot parts

$1500: Competitive - Enables us to build a competitive robot with depth sensing cameras for autonomous ball shooting

$2000: Allows us to subsidize registration costs for low income students

story:
Hello everyone,
Sometimes life takes some really hard turns and things change drastically without any heads up. These challenges are small roadblocks to our success that can be over come with hard work. This past august, a received the terrible news that due to financial problems I was not going to be able to attend Penn state for my senior year of college. It devastated me as I had all my bags packed and I was eager to start my senior year of college and earn my degree in biochemistry and molecular biology. I have been out of school since then. I have been working as a tutor to be able to pay my bills so far but the money is scarce. I miss school and I must finish my degree in order to be happy. Education is my passion and every waking moment of this hiatus is killing me inside. Fortunately enough, on April I will be able to register for classes at Queensborough Community College for a semester so I don't fall behind and finish my senior year of college at City College of NY in the fall. The only problem is that I cannot register for the spring semester at QCC due to a balance that I owe them for some summer classes I took. This balance I had planned to pay with funds from a scholarship I receive every year but unfortunately the scholarship cannot diburse the funds to pay it off since I am not enrolled in classes currently. The total amount due is 4250 dollars. I am stuck in this dire situation and have been able to work and put together 750 dollars so far (after bills I've had to pay, etc). I still need 3500 dollars more to be able to register for classes. I need to be able to come up with this money by February 25. I hate having to ask for this type of help since Self reliance is huge to me but this is killing me inside. Any sort of help would go directly into paying this bill and would mean the world to me. Life put this obstacle in front of me and while I will definitely keep pushing forward to achieve my dreams, A bit of solidarity will definitely help a lot. If you have read this far I would just like to take some time to say thanks!

story:
Why We Rise Up!

Knowing the importance of a proper education and acknowledging the struggle of some parents to properly furnish their child for such a venture, Rise Up Bequia Inc.‘s initiative for the past five years has been to assist as best as we can. Our project began with the distribution of care packages and vouchers to students who were identified as having difficulties in acquiring necessities for school.  However, over the years we realized that the need for school supplies was much greater than we first expected or anticipated and so our annual summer vacation book drive was born.  Last year, 2017, we were able to supply over 350 students from seven schools on the island with notebooks, copybooks and stationery; this being a major step up from the 176 students of 2016 and even fewer in the years before. Unfortunately, because of the limited amount of books we were able to afford there were still students in need who were unable to be gifted with packages.

So as to ensure that no student is left disappointed or ill equipped in their quest to attain education, our goal for this year is to supply books to EVERY student on the island of Bequia. This would definitely be a herculean task and so we are soliciting your support to aid in the accomplishment of this very worthy cause.

Help us help the students of Bequia to recognize their dreams, make them into reality and be the very best at whatever they will grow up to be.

story:
Pathways Community School is a new charter high school that opened in South Los Angeles in August 2014.

We are located in a community where the average income is $22,565 and 56% of children live below the poverty line.  Access to fresh and healthy food is scarce and for many of our students the food they eat at school will be their only meals for the day.

We have made it a priority to provide a fresh and healthy breakfast and lunch to every student, every day and to do so we needed to purchase an oven.  We have included the meals in our budget but the oven will push us over budget and will limit the number of free meals that we can provide to our students.

What We Need

The oven cost $6000.00.   This purchase will allow us to provide freshly-made meals for years to come, but in the short term it has displaced funding for student meals.  Your contribution will allow us to continue to provide free meals to all of our students through the end of the school year.

Contribution Levels

ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE

Our contribution levels reflect the cost of feeding a student a fresh and healthy breakfast and lunch for:

One Day - $5.00

For a $5.00 contribution you will receive a personalized thank you note and a public "thank you" on the Pathways Community School Facebook page

One Week - $25.00

For a $25.00 contribution you will receive a Pathways Athletics t-shirt and a personalized thank you note.  You will also receive a public "thank you" on the Pathways Community School Facebook page.

One Month - $100.00

For a $100.00 contribution you will receive a Pathways golf shirt and a personalized thank you note.  You will also receive a public "thank you" on the Pathways Community School Facebook page.

1/2 a school year - $500.00

For a $500.00 contribution you will receive a Pathways hoodie with our new student-designed mascot graphic.  You will also receive a personalized thank you note and a public "thank you" on the Pathways Community School Facebook page.

A full school year - $1000

For a $1000 contribution we will add your name to our weekly menu: "These fresh and healthy meals are brought to you by..."  You will also receive your choice of t-shirt or hoodie, a personalized thank you card, and a public "thank you" on the Pathways Community School Facebook page.

Stretch Goals

Our commitment to health goes beyond nutrition.  Many of our students struggle with impulse control/anger issues among other mental, emotional and physical health problems.  We have partnered with a mental health provider to support our students through counseling and working with our students to learn biofeedback strategies to address their anger responses.  The device used for the biofeedback process costs $300.00 so any funding beyond $6000.00 will go towards purchasing these devices.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the link to our fundraising page with your community and anyone else who may be interested in donating.

Use the Indigogo share tools to spread the word on your Facebook and Twitter feeds!

story:
Thank you for all of the support for the first stage of crowdfunding for the IWA's constitutional convention. This has now finished, but will pay for the initial design of the website where the debate will be hosted. We now need to raise further funds for the management of the project throughout the live debate. You can donate here:  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/iwa-s-consti...

What kind of Wales do you want for your children?

Following Scotland's decisive vote, the debate over the future shape of the UK is now taking off in earnest, but where is Wales' voice?  What kind of Wales do you want for your children? Now is the time to discuss the type of Government we should have. 

Independent think-tank the Institute of Welsh Affairs (IWA) is setting up a Constitutional Convention above the heads of the political elites. We will be drawing on the example of Iceland where crowd sourcing techniques were used to draw up a new constitution in the wake of their economic crisis.

The Convention will:

  • Give people the chance to shape the political and economic future of Wales.
  • Be independent from all political parties.
  • Encourage people in Wales to take part, online. 

Why we need your help?

The IWA is a registered charity (1078435) and an independent think tank dedicated to making Wales a better place to live and work.  

We are not aligned to any political party and receive no funding from the Government, and as such we're uniquely placed to challenge Government. We are a well established and trusted 'safe space' where debate can take place. 

We can't organise this convention without your help, we are writing to Trusts, asking our members and seeking crowd funding to help us organise this convention.  We plan to:

  • Set up a bespoke website to crowdsource opinions.
  • Recruit participants  and encourage them to take part.
  • Draft a report based on responses and feed-in to the debate in Government. 

If you can't provide funding support, please help in other ways, please tell other people about our campaign and ask others to spread the word or donate.
