story:
Our Story

Hello! My name is Mara Magyarosi and I'm bringing the One Million Bones project to Henry Ford Academy: School for Creative Studies. We are holding a three day event on November 9-11 filled with activities surrounding this project. 

A little background: 

The One Million Bones project was created by Naomi Natale, and you can find all sorts of information about it at onemillionbones.org. The basic idea behind it is that one million people each create one bone to represent one person who has been killed by genocide. These bones, created from clay in this particular case, will be laid out in the National Mall in Washington DC in 2013 as a mass grave.

College for Creative Studies brought the One Million Bones project to freshman year orientation this year. As a teaching assistant, I had the opportunity to participate with the students on an educational level - discussing what this project means and how art activism can affect a community. We were the largest group of people to ever do this project at the same time before, and this is something that stuck in my mind.

Henry Ford Academy: School for Creative Studies is the partner middle and high school that housed at the same location as College for Creative Studies. As a duel major in photography and art education, I have wanted to find a way to bring a community art project to the entire high school, and this project was the perfect opportunity. We will once again knock out of the park the amount of people participating on the project at one time by almost 75 people, which will put not only our schools' combined partnership on the national map, but Detroit as well. 


As artists, it is our responsibility to not only make a difference to the world, but to educate others on how to as well. By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping us fund the supplies for the entire high school to be able to participate!


The Impact

This campaign is already having a national impact. By simply having the conversation about what we are willing to accept about the treatment of people on the high school level, tolerance and equality can be spread early.


There also is the smaller impact that the students at Henry Ford Academy: School for Creative Studies do not currently have clay in any part of their curriculum, so by having this project, we are introducing an entire possible medium to all of the students. This can open up possibilities for them for a lifetime.


What We Need & What You Get

The basics of what we need are supplies! Any funding that you can contribute will greatly help us in our goal of funding this incredible project.

The breakdown:

$300 = Clay for the bones

$300 = Paper to cover the tables in the classrooms

$100 = Tarps to cover the gymnasium floor during the installation

$100 = Pizza boxes to carry the bones in after the installation


Other Ways You Can Help

We don't have very long to fund this, so please spread the word! Feel free to share this with friends, and any contribution would be greatly appreciated!
story_txt:
Our Story
Hello! My name is Mara Magyarosi and I'm bringing the One Million Bones project to Henry Ford Academy: School for Creative Studies. We are holding a three day event on November 9-11 filled with activities surrounding this project. 
A little background: 
The One Million Bones project was created by Naomi Natale, and you can find all sorts of information about it at onemillionbones.org. The basic idea behind it is that one million people each create one bone to represent one person who has been killed by genocide. These bones, created from clay in this particular case, will be laid out in the National Mall in Washington DC in 2013 as a mass grave. 
College for Creative Studies brought the One Million Bones project to freshman year orientation this year. As a teaching assistant, I had the opportunity to participate with the students on an educational level - discussing what this project means and how art activism can affect a community. We were the largest group of people to ever do this project at the same time before, and this is something that stuck in my mind.
Henry Ford Academy: School for Creative Studies is the partner middle and high school that housed at the same location as College for Creative Studies. As a duel major in photography and art education, I have wanted to find a way to bring a community art project to the entire high school, and this project was the perfect opportunity. We will once again knock out of the park the amount of people participating on the project at one time by almost 75 people, which will put not only our schools' combined partnership on the national map, but Detroit as well. 

As artists, it is our responsibility to not only make a difference to the world, but to educate others on how to as well. By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping us fund the supplies for the entire high school to be able to participate!


The Impact
This campaign is already having a national impact. By simply having the conversation about what we are willing to accept about the treatment of people on the high school level, tolerance and equality can be spread early. 

There also is the smaller impact that the students at Henry Ford Academy: School for Creative Studies do not currently have clay in any part of their curriculum, so by having this project, we are introducing an entire possible medium to all of the students. This can open up possibilities for them for a lifetime.


What We Need & What You Get
The basics of what we need are supplies! Any funding that you can contribute will greatly help us in our goal of funding this incredible project. 
The breakdown:
$300 = Clay for the bones
$300 = Paper to cover the tables in the classrooms
$100 = Tarps to cover the gymnasium floor during the installation
$100 = Pizza boxes to carry the bones in after the installation


Other Ways You Can Help
We don't have very long to fund this, so please spread the word! Feel free to share this with friends, and any contribution would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Who Are We?

Crocus Academy Main Street is a quality preschool and prekindergarten program located in the heart of Bardstown. We offer a Bible based curriculum that includes an emphasis on all the core content areas required for a quality early childhood education. Crocus Academy opened in Bardstown in 2003, and we opened our second location in Elizabethtown in 2009. Our goal is to prepare young children socially, academically and spiritually for kindergarten without sacrificing the joy, wonder and curiosity of learning.

Every year we send out fundraiser packets to all our families in hopes of earning about $100.00 per student.  We have sold poinsettias, coffee, evergreen products and many other "big hits", but let's face it, no one likes to hit up their neighbors to buy something they really do not need.  Some of our families are new to the area or not from the area, and it is even harder to ask a stranger to support your child's school.  There is no fun in fundraising!

This year we are trying something a little different, but we need your support.  Each year we have several special needs that require funds that cannot be covered by tuition alone.  Your donation will help Crocus Academy Main Street and Crocus Academy Heartland support children and their families throughout this school year, events and activities that cannot be accomplished without your assistance.

I love our families and our staff, and every day I feel blessed to go to work, and I know they feel the same.  Ms. Karen, at a staff meeting today told me, "I can't wait to come to work on Monday!"  I have no words to express what that means, but I am pretty sure that it means that God is blessing our endeavors.

If you have a child or know a child who has ever attended Crocus Academy Main Street or Crocus Academy Heartland, then you know how wonderful our schools are, and how dedicated we are to providing the best start for young children.  Please take a moment to show your support.  Every donation will be used to provide for amazing experiences and needed opportunities for young children.

What Do We Need?

We try to make children feel special, and each year we have very specific needs for projects, events and celebrations that go beyond tuition.  Here are just a few, and I have tried to break down the approximate cost of each based upon last year's numbers.

  • Fall Festival and Thanksgiving Celebration for Each Center ($500.00)
  • Christmas Gift Books for Each Child ($200.00)
  • Donuts for Dads ($100-$200)
  • Muffins with Moms ($100-$200)
  • Graduation and Promotion Events ($300.00)
  • CCAP Co-Pay Assistance ($500.00)
  • Tuition Discounts for Military (10% Non-Deployed Active Duty and 25% Deployed Active Duty) 
  • Staff Appreciation during Child Care Provider Appreciation Week ($50-$100 per staff member)
  • Upgrades in Equipment:  This one is special.  This year we would like to make iPad labs in both centers with six iPads per center.  Obviously this is a big one, but we might as well plan for success. :)

What Makes Us Special?


Our schools are really wonderful and reflect our commitment to excellence and our dedicated staff and supportive families.  Here are a few things that make us unique.

  • 6:1 Student to Staff Ratio for Preschool Classes
  • 8:1 Student to Staff Ratio for Prekindergarten Classes
  • Bible Centered Weekly Themes

Comprehensive Curriculum that Addresses Core Content Areas like Language and Literacy; Science and Discovery; Block Play; Dramatic Play; Creative Expression; Music and Movement; Fine Motor and Sensory Activities; Gross Motor Activities; Self Help Skills, Social and Emotional Development and Screening and Assessment 

Educated and Experienced Teachers with Degrees that Include Associates in Interdisciplinary Early Childhood Education, Bachelors in IECE, Child Development Associates Degree, Commonwealth Child Care Credential, Director Credential, Training Credential, and more

  • Positive Discipline for Preschoolers
  • Ranked 3 Stars in the STARS for Kids Now Quality Enhancement Initiative
  • Discounted Rates for Active Non-Deployed (10%) and Deployed (25%) Military Families

The Impact

Crocus Academy Main Street and Crocus Academy Heartland are centers that impact the communities.  Our students enter kindergarten programs confident and ready for success in school.  Your contributions will be a huge help in that process. I know that all these "extras" sound like a lot, but the little things matter.  We are small schools that strive to cater not only to the needs our our students and their families, but also to provide a quality employment opportunity to teachers who often get overlooked in the field of education.  A parent once told me that preschool might be more important than college, because if you don't like school young, then you may never get to college.  I chose the name Crocus Academy, because I think the crocus is pretty special.  It is the first flower of spring, often pushing up through snow and ice, and it blooms in every climate.  I want Crocus Academy to be the first place that children experience a lifelong love of learning, and I want them to "bloom" wherever they go.  

Risks & Challenges

Every year we start school with a set program and goals for the year, but things come up, and needs often change.  At Crocus Academy, we are dedicated to seeking solutions that go beyond money.  We partner with families to provide for needs where we can, and we commit to our families even during times of financial stress and uncertainty.  My personal commitment includes foregoing any personal compensation in the way of salary until all school needs are met.  My family and the families of my staff have cleaned, painted, scraped windows, planted flowers, cooked meals and much, much more to make our schools and special events successful.  We shall continue to do so, but we could use your financial help.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Donate consumables like copy paper, card stock, and other paper goods
  • Share our campaign on your social media sites  
  • Tell your friends and neighbors 
  • Check out our websites at www.crocusmainstreet.com and www.crocusheartland.com.
If your child bloomed at Crocus Academy, please share your story on your school's Facebook page or Tweet at us @CrocusMainSt

story:
In Sum

I have always wanted to help people as a doctor, nurse or EMT.  Until recently that was only a dream.  But now I've been accepted to nursing school in Seattle!  I'll be the first in my family to complete any level of schooling and am really excited by the opportunity to learn, grow and help others.

Where will your money go?

All your contributions will go toward tuition, fees and prerequisite immunizations. These are $3500 for the Nursing Assistant Certificate for the fall quarter.  Scholarships are not available for the certificate program, but I should receive a professional NAC certificate by December.  Then I will pursue the LPN (Licensed Practical Nurse) degree which has a higher chance for getting scholarships. 

What You Get

We have such good stuff to offer in exchange!  People have been asking for these things.  We're offering up entirely handmade items by myself and Kelly, including:

  • Ceviche and piñata dinner for 8 (piñata making instruction included if you want) - for close friends and family only
  • Vashon getaway at our place: king bed, private bathroom, hot tub and hammock.  Ahhhhh.....
  • A (good) caricature of your favorite pet or offspring drawn in pencil by me and framed - you supply the photo
  • Kelly's pottery including raku containers, vases, and stoneware bowls
  • A made-to-order bowl or mug with your requested (simple) design thrown by Kelly and painted by me (can maintain the "Beto for Nurse!" theme)
  • "Beto for Nurse!" temporary tattoos, stickers or canvas bags
  • A visit from Beto the Nurse with your stuffed animal or pet.  Includes stethoscope use, digital photo with Mr. Nurse and the fuzzy, and a tattoo or sticker!
  • A whole lot of gratitude and appreciation

The Impact

(From Kelly): Beto is so proud to have the opportunity to go to nursing school and inspired to learn and help others.  The more he feels the support of our community, the more proud and successful I'm sure he'll become.  And imagine the gift you are providing those poor under-the-weather females.  What better thing in the world than a beautiful, male, Latino nurse:) 

    Risks & Challenges

    (From Kelly): Studying is always a challenge, especially for people who don't come from academic backgrounds.  But Beto is well known for his tenacity, creativity, and ability to overcome all odds.  I have no doubt he's going to make the best of this opportunity.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      (From Kelly): If you can't contribute financially, we completely understand.  Keep Beto in your thoughts and congratulate him when you see him!  (Hopefully it's not during a medical emergency:))

story:
My name is Romeo Rodriguez and I'm a volunteer in an orphanage called Hope Child Care Program located in a small village of Uganda.  This organization started as a nursery school back in 2005 and since then in their efforts to provide a complete primary education to children from the village and surroundings, every year they have integrated the next primary level in the school program. Currently the school provides education to more than 500 children up to primary 7. The first time I came to this organization was in 2009 and I stayed for 7 months to work on community development initiatives and educational programs for the orphans.  After going back home to Guatemala I joined an organization that builds and supports community libraries in rural Central America.   I knew that a library could bring so much joy and opportunities to the children I had left behind in Uganda. Four years later I’m back in this village to make it happen.

I came to the village two months ago to begin developing this library and so far I have received more than 1000 new books from different organizations in Uganda.  With support from World Possible some laptops, tablets and a Raspberry Pi with a digital library are on their way so that we will also have an IT space.  The building is being provided by the orphanage but we need funds to buy furniture in order to transform the space into a vibrant community library and learning center.

With bookshelves, tables, chairs and desks our children will be able to access the books and technology resources. They will be able to participate in reading programs that will improve their educational process and help them develop critical thinking and a love for reading. Children of all ages who have only ever dreamed about the internet will be able explore the offline versions of Wikipedia and the Khan Academy math and science videos.

Our needs are small. We need $ 1800 to fill this room with bookshelves, tables and chairs so that these young people don't have to sit on the floor and go through boxes. 

During the last four years, as the Development Officer for Riecken Community Libraries I not only witnessed the impact that community libraries and reading programs can have on students of all ages, teachers and parents, but I directed the implementation of some development programs through the libraries and even the building of the newest library in the network in Parramos, Chimaltenango, Guatemala.

The need for books and reading programs is critical here as in most villages in Africa; we are more than halfway in creating this great resource for our children and eventually all the community, I have the experience and passion to implement it but we need your support to finish it and open the door to a new world of knowledge, opportunities and fun for our children!

Thank you for your support and for sharing this!

story:
WORKx SUMMARY

We are WORKx and we are determined to help all Citizens of the United States of America to find work, a job, and/or a career.  This campaign is dedicated to my father, “John Buster “Buck” Sizemore.  I started on my personal journey to help people to get a job when I met a gentleman who was having difficulty.

“George”, as I will call him, came up to me to ask if I could help him with a few dollars.  I could tell by his embarrassment that he was ashamed to ask for money and that he was truly desperate.  I took out some money for him, but before I gave it to him, I asked him why he needed it.

He had left his home in Macon, Georgia to seek employment here in the Atlanta, Georgia area.  With a sense of dread, I asked him how he was seeking employment, although I had an instinctive sense of what he was about to say.

He said that he was checking the newspaper want ads and signed up at several work agencies, and went to the Department of Labor.  I asked if he used the internet or even had an email address.  He did not and had never considered it important.  I referred him to a nearby Dekalb County Services Office that provided basic computer skills and resume writing services, but I knew he needed much more than that.

MISSION

Our mission is to educate anyone who is technology challenged in finding work, a job, or bettering their career due to underemployment.  There will be online resources for anyone needing them, so everyone can get assistance. There are many ways to learn technology, but people are not taught how to effectively utilize it in the workforce.  We will change that.

Technology is changing on a near daily basis and traditional institutions cannot keep up, such Technology training must be “Agile”.  Agile is being able to break large problems in to smaller tasks that can be solved using current technologies in a short period of time.  Anyone that is seeking work must become “Agile”.

What We Need & What You Get

WORKx is a dedicated effort to directly create local training centers, assist in supporting tele-presence capabilities, create and manage online Learning Management System (LMS), organize/connect LTCs into a National Training Center (NTC), and coordinate efforts with government, corporations, and Non-Profit Organizations (NPO). 

Our apologies for the “Techno Speech”, but not to worry.  We can teach you how to use these abilities.  They will greatly increase anyone’s use of technology and how to use it on the job or running your own business.

Risks & Challenges

Assisting people in learning technology, primarily computers and smart phones, will greatly increase people’s quality of life and allow them to truly pursue the American Dream.  The technology and education part of WORKx is fairly straight forward and will not be a difficult problem.

The big challenge will be in organizing and assisting individuals as they are using the WORKx system.  We will be using a self-supportive system that will provide a helpful and responsive support system.

Ways You Can Help

To eradicate unemployment and to create work and jobs will literally be a project that will never end.  It will require everyone to help in whatever way they can.  If you have vast resources, such as Bill Gates or Warren Buffett, you can help in a very large way.  If you are out of work and concerned where your next meal will come from, then you can’t assist with money, but you can still help in a profound way.

To begin, you need to donate at least $1.00 to the WORKx IndieGoGo campaign.  This action exerts a strong connection to the effort.  The first action is Karma, where the positive and negative intent and actions of an individual influence the future of that individual. The second action is what the investors call “Skin in the Game”, to have money at risk by being invested in achieving a goal.  This creates an emotional connection with the intended goal.

The second action is to tell as many people as possible about the WORKx program.  We need people to fund and support the project, as well as actually using the program.  This means that everyone needs to be involved.

The third action is to be involved in the WORKx program.  Register with the national WORKx center and a plan of study will be created.  The following steps will be initiated:

1.  There will be an initial interview process to determine your present situation and desired job track.

2.  Assess Technology Knowledge Level (TKL) and assign to TKL support team, if needed*.

3.  Assign LMS curriculum and related courses.

4.  Assign a Technology Mentor.

5.  Progress will be charted by the LMS system and reviewed by the assigned mentor and an Education Manager.

6.  Education goals will documented and a certificate or diploma will be presented.  The WORKx program will explore the possibility that certified training credits or other types of certifications are available.

7.  WORKx will provide a follow-up mentor function to support any continued formal education, work situation, or career.

NOT TO WORRY

I have an extensive career of teaching computer and technology to a wide and varied group of individuals.  You must see the video that showcases some of the more interesting classes I have taught.  One such class was a group of 14 middle aged women that brought their knitting with them.  I learned several teaching principles from that group and I didn’t lose anyone.

I have taught thousands of individuals and I never lost anyone that applied themselves for at least minutes.  I did lose one person that did not apply himself for that vital five minutes and you can learn about him in an upcoming video called, “Oops”.

HOPE, LOVE, CHARITY

The foundation for WORKx is Hope, Love, and Charity.  The ability to do anything begins with Hope.

Hope is the essential beginning for all action.  Hope is the spark that creates Faith, which in turn creates Action.  We all have different ways and paths to these actions and I am here to bring Hope that everyone can learn and use technology.  I, personally, have seen what works and what does not works.  There is no one way to achieve the goals of WORKx, it will take a large organized and coordinated effort to do it.

The time to start is now.  The economic news is improving and there will be a huge increase in the job market, but anyone in the work force must be able to provide the technology skills needed to do the job.

CONCLUSION

There are many challenges for WORKx, but we will bring the people and skills together to solve them.  The 21st century is here and we all need to come together to support each other and help each other.  There is a saying that when the water rises, all the boats will also rise

able to break large problems in to smaller tasks that can be solved using
current technologies in a short period of time. 
Anyone that is seeking work must become “Agile”.
What We Need & What You Get
WORKx is a dedicated effort to
directly create local training centers, assist in supporting tele-presence
capabilities, create and manage online Learning Management System (LMS),
organize/connect LTCs into a National Training Center (NTC), and coordinate
efforts with government, corporations, and Non-Profit Organizations (NPO).  
Our apologies for the “Techno
Speech”, but not to worry.  We can teach
you how to use these abilities.  They
will greatly increase anyone’s use of technology and how to use it on the job
or running your own business.
Risks & Challenges
Assisting people in learning
technology, primarily computers and smart phones, will greatly increase
people’s quality of life and allow them to truly pursue the American
Dream.  The technology and education part
of WORKx is fairly straight forward and will not be a difficult problem.
The big challenge will be in
organizing and assisting individuals as they are using the WORKx system.  We will be using a self-supportive system
that will provide a helpful and responsive support system.
Ways You Can Help
To eradicate unemployment and to
create work and jobs will literally be a project that will never end.  It will require everyone to help in whatever
way they can.  If you have vast
resources, such as Bill Gates or Warren Buffett, you can help in a very large
way.  If you are out of work and
concerned where your next meal will come from, then you can’t assist with
money, but you can still help in a profound way.
To begin, you need to donate at
least $1.00 to the WORKx IndieGoGo campaign. 
This action exerts a strong connection to the effort.  The first action is Karma, where the positive
and negative intent and actions of an individual influence the future of that
individual. The second action is what
the investors call “Skin in the Game”, to have money at risk by being invested
in achieving a goal.  This creates an
emotional connection with the intended goal.
The second action is to tell as many
people as possible about the WORKx program. 
We need people to fund and support the project, as well as actually
using the program.  This means that
everyone needs to be involved.
The third action is to be involved
in the WORKx program.  Register with the
national WORKx center and a plan of study will be created.  The following steps will be initiated:
1. 
There will be an initial interview
process to determine your present situation and desired job track.
2. 
Assess Technology Knowledge Level
(TKL) and assign to TKL support team, if needed*.
3. 
Assign LMS curriculum and related
courses.
4. 
Assign a Technology Mentor.
5. 
Progress will be charted by the LMS
system and reviewed by the assigned mentor and an Education Manager.
6. 
Education goals will documented and
a certificate or diploma will be presented. 
The WORKx program will explore the possibility that certified training
credits or other types of certifications are available.
7. 
WORKx will provide a follow-up
mentor function to support any continued formal education, work situation, or
career.
NOT TO WORRY
I have an extensive career of
teaching computer and technology to a wide and varied group of
individuals.  You must see the video that
showcases some of the more interesting classes I have taught.  One such class was a group of 14 middle aged
women that brought their knitting with them. 
I learned several teaching principles from that group and I didn’t lose
anyone.
I have taught thousands of
individuals and I never lost anyone that applied themselves for at least
minutes.  I did lose one person that did
not apply himself for that vital five minutes and you can learn about him in an
upcoming video called, “Oops”.
HOPE, LOVE, CHARITY
The foundation for WORKx is Hope,
Love, and Charity.  The ability to do anything
begins with Hope.
Hope is the essential beginning for
all action.  Hope is the spark that
creates Faith, which in turn creates Action. 
We all have different ways and paths to these actions and I am here to
bring Hope that everyone can learn and use technology.  I, personally, have seen what works and what
does not works.  There is no one way to achieve
the goals of WORKx, it will take a large organized and coordinated effort to do
it.
The time to start is now.  The economic news is improving and there will
be a huge increase in the job market, but anyone in the work force must be able
to provide the technology skills needed to do the job.
CONCLUSION

There are many challenges for WORKx, but we will
bring the people and skills together to solve them.  The 21st century is here and we
all need to come together to support each other and help each other.  There is a saying that when the water rises,
all the boats will also rise

story:
Our technology will provide low-cost, easy-to-use software for the treatment of Autism. 


Why We Need To Do This

"Your son has autism." Those were the words that opened up the Pandora's box of relief, dread, validation, shame, certainty, fear, uncertainty, overwhelm, and a vortex of other unidentifiable emotions. We hugged our child. Then we hugged each other. Then we cried. After that we just didn't know what to do. We felt really alone.

Amidst all the theories, advice and protocols - vaccines are bad, vaccines are good, gluten is the problem, it's not your fault, hug therapy, speech pathology, respite care and the never-ending list of well-intentioned "help" that served in practice mostly to just overwhelm - we discovered ABA, "Applied Behavioural Analysis", a proven, methodical form of early intervention. We decided to give it a shot. 

One well-meaning (I presume) government official actually said to me: "it's important for you to realize that your child will likely never be able to attend a regular school and will always require assistance." I respectfully disagreed.

Funding assistance was in the early stages - we were lucky. 

But the bureaucracy was a nightmare. We had to hire a team of interventionists and a consultant with valid credentials to set up the program. We had to pay extra for her travel expenses between New Jersey and Vancouver.

Every program, every observed behaviour, every learning objective, target and individual trial was carefully recorded in binders at the end of each 2-3 hour session, of which we had 8-10 per week. Twice a week I had to spend hours transcribing this information and emailing it to our consultant so that every so often she could come to our home and make adjustments to the programs.

It was expensive. It took over our lives. We had doubts but we stuck with it. 

And it worked. 

Our son is in a regular school. He has a black belt in Kung Fu. He has friends. He's cool. He's a brilliant mathematician, does magic that is beyond me, and now just like any 16 year old he's looking for a job and working towards his driver's license. 

He still has autism and that will always be part of who he is. But ABA has helped him to function and even excel in our society. And that was worth any cost.

This isn't just my story. Back then, in 1999, autism was on the rise with about 1 in 200 children being diagnosed. According to the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, today that rate is 1 in 68. That's millions of parents with the same story you just heard. 
- Erik, "ABAKiS Guy"

Early intervention programs such as Applied Behavioural Analysis (ABA) are highly effective, but setting them up and keeping them running is an overwhelming administrative and logistical task, tacked onto the already stressful job of trying to cope with the odd and sometimes violent or dangerous behaviours of your child, and coordinating information from multiple specialists.

ABA early intervention programs by their nature require vast amounts of data to be collected and analysed in order to be effective. It may surprise you to learn that most early intervention programs even in 2014 still rely on hand written notes and hand-drawn charts, scanned or faxed to your BC (Behavioural Consultant, also sometimes known as a BCBA, Board Certified Behaviour Analyst).


It just doesn't need to be this hard.

Ineffective Communication

Okay so technically speaking, writing notes in binders and thousands of emails and spreadsheets and scans and faxes is communication, but it's not a solution. Not really.


Using paper or crude electronic means like sending documents by email are cumbersome and actually prevent effective communication among team members. 


Until they physically come to the home and sift through the binders, team members don't know what they will be working on; BC's don't know how effective their programming is; and parents don't have a clear picture of their child's progress. If you live outside a major city, this also means bearing the cost of travel for your consultant to come to your house.


By the time anyone is able to physically view the data, it's already out of date.

We Have a Modern Approach!

Having spent years struggling with these exact issues, David and Erik - soon to become the "ABAKiS Guys" - asked this simple but powerful question:


What if everyone on an intervention team could access that data on-line, instantly, from anywhere?


What if BC's could see data as it's being recorded and make adjustments instantly? What if parents, teachers and SEA's had easy access to the information that would allow them to support the program?


In today's world where it seems that everything is online, this hardly seems like a revolution does it? Yet it seemed that nobody had really tackled this problem head-on and solved it. So armed with our combined technical expertise, some database architecture, first-hand user feedback and a significant amount of effort, ABAKiS ("ABA - Keep it Simple!") was born. 


After 3 years of development and experimentation with different approaches and the faithful support of our handful of pilot users, we developed a working prototype of a cloud-based solution that allows practitioners to easily record data from sessions and instantly view the results (tabulated and graphically).


(Plus we've got a really snazzy logo with a cute squirrel.)

Who Will Benefit From ABAKiS?

We believe ABAKiS is more than just a web application. It has the power to impact people's lives and transform the way we look at autism, bringing it out of the dark ages and into the light where it belongs. 
  • Children with autism will benefit the most from ABAKiS, because their teams will be spending less time documenting results and more time focused on them. Their consultants, armed with up-to-the-minute data, will be able to accelerate their development.
  • Parents of children with autism will finally have the means to properly monitor the progress of their child's intervention program, as ABAKiS provides ready access to easily readable progress charts and comments that they can read from anywhere.
  • ABA Behavioural Consultants will save time, reduce the need for travel, and be able to provide a higher quality of service with less administrative overhead.
  • Intervention teams will have everything they need to conduct their at-home session using ABAKiS, right at their fingertips, and be able to record data easily on the spot.
  • Team leads will be spared the hours of copying, scanning, and charting results by hand, spending that time instead focusing on the child and communicating with the team.
  • Our Society will benefit from the improved social skills of autistic children, the reduced (often taxpayer-funded) costs of early intervention programs, and the opportunities for follow-on research that will help us better understand autism.

What's Next?

To start with, our top priority is to make ABAKiS available to everyone. To do this, we need to fund some additional development to make it easier to use, robust, and secure. Our fundraising target of $20,000 may not seem like much for a tech startup but we've already done most of the heavy lifting - right now we just need some help to get it to the finish line.


But there is so much more we want to do! The more money we raise, the faster we will be able to expand on the core of ABAKiS with things like:

  • Adding more customizable module types and support within ABAKiS for alternate modes of intervention and reporting such as Fluency.
  • Adding more team collaboration features such as time tracking and scheduling
  • Integrating support for school-based Individualized Education Plans for special needs children.
  • Creating a user marketplace for practitioners to exchange ideas or buy and sell standardized curricula.
  • Integrating ABAKiS with other tools such as clickers to make it even easier for practitioners to collect trial data.
  • Providing anonymized data to support professionals researching the efficacy of different autism treatment methods.

Where Will the Funds Go?

Initially our #1 priority for funding will be getting the existing core features out to the market so people can start using ABAKiS to make their lives easier. After a careful selection process we are proud to announce that we will be working with Pernix Solutions, a highly professional, outsourced, Agile-based software engineering team located in Costa Rica. (These guys are rock stars.)


Here is the rough order of spending priority for the short term:

  • Minimum development of core application to public launch
  • Customer support
  • Sales and marketing
  • Expansion of core feature set development to more fully support teams
  • Part-time directors' pay (eventually we intend to focus on ABAKiS full time)
  • Usability studies and UX enhancements

How Much Will ABAKiS Cost?

Here is a summary of our current estimate for ABAKiS subscription fees. These may change but hopefully not by much. Basic support options will be included.

Single user subscription for evaluation or very small teams:

  • Free for 14 days, then $49 per month after

Team subscription (typically 5-10 users):

  • 1 month - $99
  • 3 months - $89 per month ($267)
  • One year - $79 per month ($948)

Find out more about ABAKiS on our WEBSITE, or subscribe to our BLOG to follow our progress!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are some suggestions to help us change the face of autism early intervention:

  • Send us feedback to help us improve this campaign, either through this site or directly at info@myabakis.com
  • Do you know anyone who has a child with autism or is running an intervention team? Tell them about us! They may be eligible to recover the costs of ABAKiS through local government funding.
  • A very limited number of individual and team subscriptions will be made available at no cost, for selected users willing to trial early versions of the software and provide regular feedback. Contact us for more details.
  • Share the link to this campaign on your Facebook page. If you don't happen to know anyone struggling with autism, chances are some of your friends do!
  • Post a note of support on our Indiegogo campaign page or the ABAKiS Facebook page.
SWAG Previews!

T-Shirt (men's and ladies styles available)

Coffee Mugs

Keychain LED Flashlight

Premium Ball Cap

Foam Stress Cube

story:
Esta campanha tem como objectivo obtermos fundos para aquisição de um ovo intacto da ave-elefante (Aepyornis).

A ave-elefante viveu na ilha de Madagáscar até ao século XVII e terá inspirado muitas lendas que narravam a existência de uma ave fabulosa, gigante, que viveria numa ilha situada no sul do Oceano Índico. Existem muitos fragmentos de ovos, evidenciando que a ave deverá ter sido relativamente abundante, mas a caça excessiva e a perda de habitat conduziram-na à extinção. Os ovos intactos são extremamente raros e existem poucos em colecções públicas. O nosso objectivo é contribuir para enriquecer o acervo do Museu de História Natural e da Ciência, em Lisboa, através desta aquisição.

O ovo vai ser leiloado em Londres (na Leiloeira Christie’s - as fotos que acompanham esta campanha são fotos publicitárias da Christie’s).

A estimativa é de que o preço final se possa situar entre 20.000 e 30.000 libras esterlinas + comissão da leiloeira. Decidimos solicitar 65.000 euros para tentarmos cobrir todas as ofertas e também para as despesas relacionadas com a aquisição, como são as comissões (Christie’s e Indiegogo) e também para que o Museu NHNC possa preparar as condições necessárias à exibição pública do ovo.

Todo o dinheiro que sobrar (após a compra o ovo) será sempre para o Museu Naciobnal de História Natural e da Ciência.

Na eventualidade de não conseguirmos as verbas necessárias, todo o dinheiro que conseguirmos será entregue ao Museu Nacional de História Natural e da Ciência para que possa adquirir peças que enriqueçam as suas colecções (eventualmente, um outro ovo da ave elefante em compra privada).

Qualquer questão que tenham poderão dirigi-la a Luís Mendonça Carvalho, através do e-mail lmmc@ipbeja.pt ou ao museu botânico de Beja museu@ipbeja.pt

Esta é uma iniciativa pro bono publico.

O site da Christie's no qual se poderá ver o ovo da ave elefante é aqui (click) O leilão será no dia 24 de Abril de 2013, em Londres.

story:
Summary of CEFopoly: 

What is CEFopoly about? 

The Definition of CEFopoly: a blending of the acronym CEF and the attachment phrase “opoly” to connote and imply the feeling of a game that is fun and engaging.

                                     C = College

                                     E = Education

                                     F = Foundation

Essentially CEFopoly is the “gamification” of three important content areas / messages of information about the acquisition of "formal knowledge" through: 

[1.] The American college & university system,

[2.] Conceptual and introductory information about Intellectual Property, and

[3.] Conceptual and introductory information about Entrepreneurship 

CEFopoly is a game that provides gamers, students, parents, grandparents, educators / teachers, and anyone who is interested in the learning that takes place in games, in a format of fun and interactive engagement.  CEFopoly is designed to perk curiosity, engage the brains’ inquisitiveness, all while tantalizing the competitive juices in the game participants.  The winner is the person that at the end of the game has acquired or owns the most knowledge from within the game's subject matter areas.

Who benefits: 

All game players and participants gain while playing CEFopoly.

CEFopoly game players/participants learn while playing the game about twenty-two (22) varying major areas and courses of study from within the American college and university system. 

CEFopoly game players/participants also are provided through the two stacks of cards that are apart of the games operating rules information about common experiences and organizational situations in college, acquiring and creating intellectual property, and entrepreneurship.

One card stack is called:   "College Knowledge"

One card stack is called:    "Risk Or Reward"

This stack has interspersed information about the benefits of intellectual property, and while playing introduces the players to concepts within the area of Intellectual Property  (aka IP).  Additionally, the stack has cards in it that introduces the player/participants to the elements of entrepreneurship. 

CEFopoly game players/participants learn about the four major academic degrees:

  • Associate of Arts
  • Baccalaureate 
  • Masters
  • Doctoral

The nature and design of CEFopoly is to mix three important elements in the game:

[1.] Fun and engagement

[2.] Game competition

[3.] The conveyance of information while playing the game about important subject areas; and to spark curiosity about subject areas that have a major impact.

  1. Higher Education
  2. Intellectual Property
  3. Entrepreneurship 

 

Why CEFopoly Matters:

Why encouraging higher education, innovation, and entrepreneurship matters- 

When one looks at the great contributions made in the world over time - one of the great contributors within the last 240 years has been the USA.  There are three areas that stand out that have provided for significant advancement in the many areas that matter.   

[1.] The Morrill Land Grant Act of 1862 - Producing better educated and competently trained citizens to meet the demands of the future in a world that rewards education, the creation and or ownership of intellectual property, and entrepreneurship.

[2.] Making learning and education not only a rigorous academic activity - but also showing a young person the rewards of higher education in a fun and exciting way - CEFopoly does that.

[3.] It is true that “consumption” drives most economies - However, it is a well educated citizenry that allow countries to compete in a world of ever-higher requirements.

A fun Learning tool that can help bridge the generation gap. 

Essentially, CEFopoly is committed to fun while learning 

Provides a game environment where play takes place while learning: 

CEFopoly is first and foremost a game - and kids like playing games.

The game is designed to introduce many important areas within the college and university experience that will provide insight to the game playing participants. 

CEFopoly will spark and ignite curiosity about Intellectual Property; one of the most dynamic asset groups in the industrialized world. 

CEFopoly also introduces the game participant to the importance of entrepreneurship. 

 

Escape the boring lectures & provide a game environment to motivate learning about information that matters:

CEFopoly provides for its game participants the optimum mix of game fun, competition, curiosity and excitement while being introduced to values that will serve the playing participant over a lifetime.  It’s actually will be an inexpensive investment in as a “motivational aid” that can make a big difference in a young persons life “outside the box” of the standard “Parent lectures” about going to college.

Providing an appreciation for learning and academic curiosity in the early years matters. 

CEFopoly accepts the concept that early in a young persons life cycle habits and the appreciation for learning is most important.   CEFopoly is designed to take advantage of  “the enjoyment of playing games”  to creates the interest and curiosity of the subject matter  and areas shown in the game.

 

 

Why you should Pledge & What You Get for Pledging: 

A lot of the heavy lifting to bring CEFopoly to market has been done.

The creator and designer of the game has spent over two years doing the research and assembling talent and skill to provide a great motivational aid and a relatively inexpensive tool for any person interested in providing a fun, engaging way to ignite interest, curiosity, and an understanding  of three subject [content] areas that matter.

  1. Higher Education
  2. Intellectual Property
  3. Entrepreneurship 

The Impact

The Value of introducing the concept of Intellectual Property:

In a report released in March of 2012 about the tremendous economic impact of intellectual property, one of the opening comments was: “Innovation, the process through which new ideas are generated and put into commercial practice, is a key force behind U.S. economic growth and national competitiveness.”

An extra benefit of CEFopoly 

Many times in the world ones ability to get good and useful information is a function of circumstances [lucky or unlucky].  However, CEFopoly is available to any group of people who have access to the game - therefore many of the standard social-demographic statistics that can determine a persons life chances are bridged through CEFopoly, because the CEFopoly game is available to anyone regardless of social-demographic circumstance.

What We Need & What You Get 

What is required now is the capital funding to physically manufacture the game. Additionally, an app (digital application) is also contemplated to be introduced into the marketplace and to make available the CEFopoly game (message) digitally.

Please pledge any amount you are able to, and remember you will be helping a young person be more knowledgeable about the value of higher education, intellectual property, and entrepreneurship. 

Please see the "Perks" information describing what various levels receive.

Ways You Can Help

What else you can do to assist in bringing CEFopoly to market:

If you would “like” CEFopoly on Facebook it would be appreciated.

         https://www.facebook.com/CeFopoly

CEFopoly is also on Twitter:

On Twitter at: https://twitter.com/#!/CEFopolyMedia

Any and all amounts are appreciated - Please Pass it forward: 

If you would please pass (email) this transmittal to at least seven (7) more people, Play-it-forward to people who are like-minded like yourself today, people who are interested in seeing a fun game developed and bought to market for young people.  Please send this to people like you, who understand the value and benefit of early exposure and introduction to a game that will benefit the player throughout their lives; whether that person goes to college and becomes a great jurist like Judge Sandra Day O'Connor, or the next Albert Einstein, whether that person while playing CEFopoly becomes motivated to become the next Elvis Presley, Ray Charles, or Michael Jackson (owners of their musical creations and cultural contributions) a Steve Jobs (a person that pursued his vision of the power of technology and design that has revolutionized the ownership value and use of a simple device like a phone., a Jonas Salk (a college-educated and trained medical research scientist) - and the discoverer of the vaccine that provided the world with a preventive cure for polio), a Dr. Charles R. Drew (also a highly well-trained physician and medical researcher that provided the world with his “body of work” that established the science of blood transfusion to assist anyone, regardless of national origin or culture, who needed surgery and the use of blood transfer/transfusions the appreciation and conceptual curiosity about intellectual property.  Essentially innovation and intellectual property are of the same origin. And by the playing of CEFopoly the players are provided an early introduction to the concept of “entrepreneurship” - and thereby provides a young person information that enables him or here to be internally motivated and/or inspired to build or start a business. 

It is well documented that internal motivation is a very powerful human attribute.  Providing a young person an opportunity to be exposed to a game that presents very useful motivational information is very meaningful.

And if you are interested in sharing the opportunity to be apart of a "GAME CHANGER" product (learning tool) in the world of "Edutainment" (education & entertainment) in a way that creates internal motivation within the games players towards areas that matter -please share today this opportunity with your alumni buddies, classmates, friends, family, and associates.

Thank you

Summary of CEFopoly: 
What is CEFopoly about? 
The Definition of CEFopoly: a blending of the acronym CEF and the attachment phrase “opoly” to connote and imply the feeling of a game that is fun and engaging.
                                     C = College
                                     E = Education
                                     F = Foundation
Essentially CEFopoly is the “gamification” of three important content areas / messages of information about the acquisition of "formal knowledge" through: 
[1.] The American college & university system,
[2.] Conceptual and introductory information about Intellectual Property, and
[3.] Conceptual and introductory information about Entrepreneurship 
CEFopoly is a game that provides gamers, students, parents, grandparents, educators / teachers, and anyone who is interested in the learning that takes place in games, in a format of fun and interactive engagement.  CEFopoly is designed to perk curiosity, engage the brains’ inquisitiveness, all while tantalizing the competitive juices in the game participants.  The winner is the person that at the end of the game has acquired or owns the most knowledge from within the game's subject matter areas.
Who benefits: 
All game players and participants gain while playing CEFopoly.
CEFopoly game players/participants learn while playing the game about twenty-two (22) varying major areas and courses of study from within the American college and university system. 
CEFopoly game players/participants also are provided through the two stacks of cards that are apart of the games operating rules information about common experiences and organizational situations in college, acquiring and creating intellectual property, and entrepreneurship.
One card stack is called:   "College Knowledge"
One card stack is called:    "Risk Or Reward"
This stack has interspersed information about the benefits of intellectual property, and while playing introduces the players to concepts within the area of Intellectual Property  (aka IP).  Additionally, the stack has cards in it that introduces the player/participants to the elements of entrepreneurship. 
CEFopoly game players/participants learn about the four major academic degrees:

Associate of Arts
Baccalaureate 
Masters
Doctoral

The nature and design of CEFopoly is to mix three important elements in the game:
[1.] Fun and engagement
[2.] Game competition
[3.] The conveyance of information while playing the game about important subject areas; and to spark curiosity about subject areas that have a major impact.

Higher Education
Intellectual Property
Entrepreneurship

story:
Are you ready to unleash the true potential of your voice?

"The 21-Day Vocal Practice Efficiency Program" (for singers), is an extremely efficient step-by-step framework for dramatically improving your voice. 

The program is designed to put you in a position to reach to your true singing potential and abilities.

How?

  • 30 minutes of daily exercises give you the concrete tools to quickly get your voice into performance shape
  • A focus on your body and quickly and efficiently developing the muscles supporting the voice.
  • It's not about repetitive singing exercises (NO singing scales and arpeggios over and over!!)

It works.

As you complete the program you will experience:

  • a higher and wider vocal range

  • the ability to sing longer phrases without running out of air

  • more personality and depth in the quality of your tone

  • the ability to use your body to fully support your voice

  • concrete results every time you practice.

The program has been refined over several years through research, input by experts, and testing by professional musicians.

Now I am taking the next step of releasing the full program to the public.

How did it happen?

My name is Sanne Graulund, and I'm a professional singer, composer and voice trainer from Copenhagen, Denmark.

I've been writing, performing, and teaching musicians from many countries, and of all levels (from beginners to professional singers) for over 25 years.

In the beginning...
Back when I was starting out as a professional musician, I was determined to succeed - and I did. However, I also used to suffer from performance anxiety. It would physically affect my voice and distract me from the music itself.

It was enormously frustating, but I was determined to do something about it.

From this frustration, emerged the seeds of The 21-Day Vocal Practice Efficiency Program.

The breakthrough!!
I began developing a series of exercises for using my body to fully support my voice, and to my amazement, this quickly put me into the best performance shape of my life.

I learned to trust my voice, allowing me to fully overcome my earlier anxieties.

I began sharing these exercises with my students – I have been teaching  students of all levels, from beginners to professional singers, for over 25 years. They quickly experienced similar results as I had. They still do.

A full 21-Day Program!
I have now developed the exercises into a full 21-Day Practice Efficiency Program - ready to launch.

Why am I asking for your support?

The full 21-Day program and overall script for each day of exercises are ready. Now with your support, I will be able to:

  • film and produce the 21-Day Program
  • produce the supporting e-book
  • create and update website content

Your contribution, whether small or large, is GREATLY appreciated.

Other ways you can help

Please me get the word out to fellow musicians - whether friends, colleagues or acquaintance!

Please send them the link to my campaign, if you think it may be something for them, or if they have friends and colleagues who may be interested.

story:
**it's-A-miracle Bath-time Jesus is now available at http://bath-time-jesus.myshopify.com/** 

*If you want buy more than one Bath-time Jesus, T-shirt or Koozy, just leave a comment telling me what items you paid for.

(Jesus is ready to ship in the US. T-shirts, koozies and perks to international backers will be sent out in January)


You need Jesus in your life!

it's-A-miracle! Bath-time Jesus is the inspirational alternative to the frivolous, secular and often evil bath toys currently available to children. It is also the first time that the awesome power of Jesus' miracles have manifested in the form of an inflatable bath toy, and it is only available here on Indiegogo. Order yours today, and be one of the first to experience the miracle!

Don't have kids? Don't take baths? Don't worry!

it's-A-miracle! Bath-time Jesus makes the perfect toy or decoration for your home, office, car, anywhere. Bath-time Jesus will stand upright on any flat surface. Just try to knock him down and he will miraculously stand right back up!

How does it work?

No one really knows for certain. Many scientists try to explain away Bath-time Jesus' powers by saying that there is simply a weight at the base of the toy, which creates a low center of gravity and keeps it upright. Others believe that it's-A-miracle! Bath-time Jesus harnesses powers that science can never explain and that we here on Earth can never fully understand. Will this debate ever be solved? Probably not.

Why Indiegogo?

We have just received the first run of 1,000 Bath-time Jesuses from our manufacturer, and they are ready to be shipped so that they can bless the lives (and baths) of people all over the world. Of course, some day it's-A-miracle! Bath-time Jesus will be on the shelves of Christian Bath toy superstores across the country, but we need your help to get there. The money we raise here on Indiegogo will help us with the general cost of doing business (packaging, building a website, registering trademarks, etc.) Order Bath-time Jesus today, and support us further by checking out our other perks! 

Rewards:

it's-A-miracle! Bath-time Jesus:

Beer Koozy:


T-shirt: 

*If you buy a shirt, leave your size in the comments section 

Help us spread the good word about Bath-time Jesus!

We need your help bringing our message to the masses. Please share our project with your friends and family, like our project on Facebook and Twitter, or just go out to the corner of your street and scream at passersby. Every little bit helps!

Thank You

Thank you so much to everyone that pledged and supported us, but there were a few people who really helped put this thing together. So, a special thanks to:

Robbie Torres - for all the graphic design and video editing

Jonathan Mullins - mixing the sound and story-boarding

James Lehigh - voice talent

Ben Torres - helping with the video and the entire project from the beginning 

Tilly Fox Merrick - acting talent

Ian Merrick - best boy

story:
A Little History

Chinatown Youth Initiatives is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering New York City Youth with the knowledge and skills to address the needs to Chinatown, Asian Americans and other underrepresented communities. Chinatown Beautification Day began as a project created by Chinatown Youth Initiative's 2003 Summer Leadership Institute. The original mission was to address concerns that Manhattan's Lower East Side had become neglected in the aftermath of 9/11. Since 2003, CYI has held CBD annually, consistently gathering between 150 and 350 high school youth to clean the streets of Chinatown. In 2009, CBD was expanded to include the citywide High School Youth Conference, which preceded CBD in the same weekend.Chinatown Beautification Day 2013!

The 11th Annual Chinatown Beautification Day is coming up on August 17th and 18th! Chinatown Beautification Day is a two-day event, consisting of a youth conference and a clean-up day during which student volunteers help tidy up Chinatown. At the conference, youth attend workshops on a variety of issues, including mental health, women's empowerment, hip hop as a tool for social justice, environmental justice, and cultural identity.

CBD is a great way for youth to get involved in their community as well as to meet new people and learn more about themselves. CBD is also a way to spread awareness about community service as well as protecting the environment of Chinatown to Chinatown residents and the greater community.

This year, our theme for CBD is "Speak! Redefining Our Narratives." During the event, we want students to explore what "narrative" means to them and share their own narratives with each other, learning from and redefining narratives together.

We Need Your Help!

In order for this event to be possible, we need to raise money in order to pay for supplies for cleaning, food for the conference, T-shirts for the participants, the various performers and speakers who help make up the CBD experience and for event space. 

We're trying to raise $4000 so that we have all the funds we need for the event as well as for future Chinatown Beautification Days to come. So please contribute anything you can and spread the word. Every little bit helps!

We want to get all our funds by August 3, but if you want to donate after the deadline, feel free to donate to our organization on NetworkforGood: https://www.networkforgood.org/donation/ExpressDonation.aspx?ORGID2=20-0352742&vlrStratCode=aKuDimm6R4hhtBvzLnzpSVqansvA6UUoAJgedljoSO6tKAy%2f%2b1UITvpGy9hn6tmo.

story:
Reversing African Brain Drain

 

Recent estimates indicate that 20,000 African professionals (doctors, university lecturers, engineers, etc.) leave the continent of Africa every year adding to the 300,000 plus highly qualified African Diaspora. On the other hand, there has been a significant increase of students in African universities with few resources to meet their needs.  It is not unusual in some universities for a class to have over 500 students without textbooks. This shortage of teaching professionals affects the quality of classroom instruction. For the past five years, Here and Home, Inc. has collaborated with a number of African universities to address this problem by sending qualified volunteer teachers to teach classes during summer.  So far 23 professors, mostly African diaspora, have taught 25 courses to 710 students in five universities.  In order to provide the quality of instruction local teachers are working hard to maintain, we really need your help.

=============================================================

About the project

My name is Issumael Nzamutuma, President of Here and Home, Inc. (HHI) incorporated in Massachusetts in 2005. It was founded by African university professors in the United States to encourage African Diaspora and friends of Africa to support African higher education institutions by donating their time to teach summer courses in African universities.

How the program works

Here and Home, Inc.

- Receives requests for teachers from African Universities. Many requests received have been in the areas of accounting, finance, mathematics, and computer science,

- Looks for qualified and passionate  teachers from universities in the United States or Europe, and

- Raises funds for airline tickets and other travel-related expenses like medicine, visa, and vaccinations.

Host institutions provide free room and board to teachers

Teachers donate their time for a maximum of four weeks.

 


Dr. Enoch Hwang from La Sierra University and Data Link Institute students using a lab kit donated by Global Specialties, Yorba Linda, CA.

 


Dr. Peter Theuri from Northern Kentucky University with his students in Intermediate Accounting at Valley View University in Ghana.

BENEFITS

Students receive instructions from teachers of different backgrounds and experience. Some teachers have donated electronic equipment from the United States. Local and visiting teachers collaborate and share teaching techniques to improve student learning.

For this coming summer we received requests for 30 teachers but because of limited resources we know that we are unable to fulfill this urgent need.  We would like to send at least 11 teachers. To accomplish this goal, Here and Home, Inc. is committed to raise $22,000.

For those who have already given their contribution for this year, please help us further by sharing this campaign with your friends using the indiegogo share tool and encouraging them to help us reach our goal.
story_txt:
Reversing African Brain Drain
 
Recent estimates indicate that 20,000 African professionals (doctors, university lecturers, engineers, etc.) leave the continent of Africa every year adding to the 300,000 plus highly qualified African Diaspora. On the other hand, there has been a significant increase of students in African universities with few resources to meet their needs.  It is not unusual in some universities for a class to have over 500 students without textbooks. This shortage of teaching professionals affects the quality of classroom instruction. For the past five years, Here and Home, Inc. has collaborated with a number of African universities to address this problem by sending qualified volunteer teachers to teach classes during summer.  So far 23 professors, mostly African diaspora, have taught 25 courses to 710 students in five universities.  In order to provide the quality of instruction local teachers are working hard to maintain, we really need your help.
=============================================================
About the project
My name is Issumael Nzamutuma, President of Here and Home, Inc. (HHI) incorporated in Massachusetts in 2005. It was founded by African university professors in the United States to encourage African Diaspora and friends of Africa to support African higher education institutions by donating their time to teach summer courses in African universities.
How the program works
Here and Home, Inc. 
- Receives requests for teachers from African Universities. Many requests received have been in the areas of accounting, finance, mathematics, and computer science,
- Looks for qualified and passionate  teachers from universities in the United States or Europe, and
- Raises funds for airline tickets and other travel-related expenses like medicine, visa, and vaccinations.
Host institutions provide free room and board to teachers
Teachers donate their time for a maximum of four weeks.
 
Dr. Enoch Hwang from La Sierra University and Data Link Institute students using a lab kit donated by Global Specialties, Yorba Linda, CA.
 
 Dr. Peter Theuri from Northern Kentucky University with his students in Intermediate Accounting at Valley View University in Ghana.
BENEFITS
Students receive instructions from teachers of different backgrounds and experience. Some teachers have donated electronic equipment from the United States. Local and visiting teachers collaborate and share teaching techniques to improve student learning.
For this coming summer we received requests for 30 teachers but because of limited resources we know that we are unable to fulfill this urgent need.  We would like to send at least 11 teachers. To accomplish this goal, Here and Home, Inc. is committed to raise $22,000.
For those who have already given their contribution for this year, please help us further by sharing this campaign with your friends using the indiegogo share tool and encouraging them to help us reach our goal.

story:
This June, teaching artists Angee Lennard and Colin Palombi will travel to Viljoenskroon, South Africa to help local youth create animations. Working with the creative arts charity Dramatic Need, Angee and Colin will spend three weeks with secondary students at Pete Patsa Community Arts Centre, drawing, sharing stories, learning about animation and playing with optical toys. This self-funded trip is a cultural exchange as well as as an opportunity to foster self-confidence and self-expression in a creative environment - an opportunity that is rare for rural South African youth.

Expenses:

We've already invested close to $4000 to get ourselves to and from South Africa. Now we are asking for help from friends to cover all the other costs associated with this adventure. We need to get from Johannesburg to Viljoenskroon, where we will be living and teaching. We need art supplies for our students, groceries, train tickets to Cape Town, vaccinations, and the like.

Outcomes:

We are visiting South Aftrica during winter break. Thus, we will be able to work with students in a concentrated environment, offering three week-long animation workshops to three different groups of students. These classes will culminate in a collection of finished animations - some combination of collaborative group projects and personal narratives or experiments.

In addition to facilitating student animations, this trip will also provide us much-needed time to create our own artwork. Through out our stay, we'll be plugging away on our own animation - a project we hope to be our most substantial collaborative animation yet!

View the Dramatic Need blog to learn more about the organization we're partnering with. View our collaborative animations, Gulp and Gifting.


About the Teaching Artists:

Angee Lennard is an art administrator,  artist, and educator. After receiving her BFA from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago in 2005, she founded a community printshop, Spudnik Press Cooperative. This non-profit organization has grown from a small work-live space to a 4,000 square foot studio. She oversees a range of community-based arts programming including open studio sessions, classes, a residency program, keyholder memberships, consignment printing, collaborative projects, youth programming, and exhibitions. For the last 6 years, she has been a teaching artist at Marwen, an organization that educates and inspires under-served young people through the visual arts. Working with 6th through 12th grade students, she's led classes ranging from “Surreal Printmaking” to “Chicago Posters”. A recent class partnered with The Jane Addams Hull-House Museum. Students learned about the history of social justice, and created a zine addressing food, politics, and community.

Colin Palombi is a Montessori trained adolescent teacher and has taught art, history, and media at the Montessori School of Lake Forest since 2004. He holds a BFA from The School of the Art Institute of Chicago and completed his Assistants to Infancy (Birth to 3) training at the Montessori Institute in Denver, CO in 2007. In 2008 he completed a Masters Degree in Montessori Education from Loyola College in Baltimore, MD. Colin has continued to pursue his own art, focusing on themes of repetition and discovery, while at the same time recognizing teaching as a creative process in its own right. In addition, Colin regularly produces video for the Oak Park River Forest Spoken Word Club as well as local musicians. He is the bass player for local band, Velvetron, is a member and instructor at Spudnik Press, a community print studio in Chicago, and serves as a project coordinator for Homeroom Chicago, a non-profit arts organization.

story:
My name is Dionne. I am called to be a midwife. My great grandmother was a birth keeper in Jamaica - my birthplace. She was my first introduction to midwifery. Although she has inspired me to follow in her footsteps, it was after giving birth to my five beautiful children that I developed a love and passion for the care, dedication and holistic art of midwifery.

On my journey to answer my midwifery calling, I have found, and am pursuing the perfect opportunity. I will be attending the Mercy in Action Intensive Academic Midwifery training in Boise, Idaho from September to November, 2013. Upon completion of my academics, I will be travelling abroad to complete my midwifery internships where I will be working alongside local midwives to serve mothers and babies at a clinics in underserved communities over the next 2 years.

Upon achieving Certified Professional Midwife Certification through NARM, it is my dream to build a midwifery practice based on the philosophy that the practice of midwifery is one that perceives childbirth and pregnancy as a natural, healthy life event. And to offer SAFE, culturally sensitive care that is assessable to all.

I will work towards closing the gaps between members of the healthcare team – working together in an atmosphere of respect.

In the future, I see myself advocating strongly for young women everywhere. Instilling the knowledge and confidence within themselves to realize they have a voice and that every woman has a right to a peaceful birth. I see myself supporting and encouraging them through what I believe to be one of the most wonderful and profound life experience.

 According to the World Health Organization (WHO), "Investing in health systems—especially in midwife training and in making emergency obstetric care available round-the-clock—is key to reducing maternal mortality”, yet more than 58 countries lack enough qualified midwives to provide timely access to skilled healthcare for mothers and infants. That’s why I have chosen this journey and your support is invaluable to me.

I invite you to become part of the solution, while helping me answer my life’s calling.

Your contribution, in any amount, will go to:

 Help me pay for my tuition, which includes:

Personalized clinical placements and academic study overseen by an experienced midwife preceptor.

 Leadership training, including business development and community-building skills

The purchase of required textbooks, essential medical equipment and pay for room and board while living abroad

Provide resources to support birth clinics in underserved regions around the world    

Provision of basic birth care supplies and medical equipment

Development of the birth clinic where I am placed

Provision of basic maternal healthcare education to local women and frontline health workers.

I am guided to continue cultivating the work of past generations of midwives such as my great grandmother and to educate and empower future generations of women and families.

Thank you for your support.

Dionne, aspiring midwife Ontario, Canada
