story:
About Young Faces Smiling

Young Faces Smiling (YFS) is a registered 501(c)(3), non-profit organization that is committed to improving the academic performance, self-esteem and overall achievement level of students in underserved communities. Young Faces Smiling operates an innovative, school-based program that motivates and inspires students using lessons that incorporate real life examples and practical applications taken from student interviews of prominent leaders in business, fashion, entertainment, media, music, sports and politics.  This inventive approach, “Reality Teaching,” has proven to be highly effective in significantly improving academic performance, self-confidence and overall success rate of the students it serves. 

Moreover, students will have an opportunity to associate and make powerful connections with successful celebrities who are as compassionate in education as educators.  But most importantly, given the current economic challenges facing us, supporters of Young Faces Smiling will make a significant difference in the lives of students at a time when it has never matter more. 

What is Reality Teaching?

Reality Teaching is media, pop culture, and entertainment elements from the outside world bringing it into the classroom to translate into math, English, science, social studies, arts and technology, which will be taught to students in various lessons. Reality Teaching will improve, inspire, and motivate students to increase their academic performance emphasizing the importance of education.

What We Need 

Help us put a SMILE on many YOUNG FACES. We need your donations.

On April 21, 2006, we officially launched Young Faces Smiling. Our vision and dream began. Dr. Eloise L. Young and I (Ms. A. McClarty) had the honor to serve and give over 1,000 students in New York State and Oklahoma City A Reality Classroom Adventure. Young Faces Smiling intends to continue giving students a once in a lifetime educational opportunity to effectively communicate with various celebrities and leaders.

Young Faces Smiling Goals and Dreams 

  • Design and create YFS (t-shirts, book bags, hats, mugs, Notebooks, and Pens).

  • Hire professional camera crew, photographer, graphic designer and editor.

  • Create professional HD education documentary with celebrities ready for TV.

  • Students attend Broadway Play and meet celebrity.

  • Take students to Restaurants to meet and eat with celebrity chefs. 

  • Assist in major celebrity events with 100 + students (ex: stay in school don’t be a dropout).

  • Purchase various books and items featuring celebrity for all students in YFS.

  • On-going interview projects with students and celebrities.

  • Travel outside of New York for various celebrity interviews.

  • Write a book(s) – History of YFS and Students voice about their experiences with celebrities during their educational journey.

  • Create an EPK package and 

    Launch pad to take YFS Global.

Please consider making a monetary contribution.  

All money is tax deductible. This is a 501c3 not-for-profit company.

What You Get

You get the Perks along with helping and motivating inner city kids to never think about dropping out of school and to possibly obtain a College Degree. 

How Do Students Feel About Young Faces Smiling

“I really appreciate all of your generosity and efforts to change our outlook on life.  After this program I realized that I could achieve my goals and accomplish my dreams.  You have a huge heart Dr. Young.”

-Nicholas, Bread & Roses HS

“I thought Ms. McClarty was making us write letters just for fun or to rub the millionaires’ success on us.  I was amazed at how these famous hard-working people took time out to see us.  Their success inspired me.  Young Faces Smiling would go along the best of the best.”

-Amanda, South Bronx Prep HS

“I really want to thank you for starting this program and also for saving a person’s life.”

-Jamilah, Bread & Roses HS

“Being in this program has made me become a better person.  Meeting Camille from America’s Next Top Model and Ms. Westbrook from Jive Turkey was very exciting.  I had a lot of fun.”

-Tito, South Bronx Prep HS

The Impact

Young Faces Smiling is our vision to stress the importance of education and career exposure for students whom may never experience this level of access throughout their regular public school journey.Our students have had significant academic turnaround as a result of this program. Their educational journey has become even greater than we have ever imagined. As a result of this growth, the needs of Young Faces Smiling have grown significantly. Our sole desire is to continue to serve students. Dr. Young and I have personally funded Young Faces Smiling for the duration of this company and are actively seeking funding support.  

We truly appreciate your support in advance.

Young Faces Smiling is my vision and dream. Young Faces Smiling has the ability to empower children forgotten about who just become more like statistics in remembrance. Like so many trailblazers before me, I must push on in an effort to educate those not forgotten but those in power, thus enabling the change in mindset and setting the tone for more greatness. Heralded but this creation, Young Faces will Smile and rejoice in curriculum that doesn't bore of benign redundancy as students embrace education related to what appeals and appears most in our POP CULTURE TV SCREEN. I cannot continue this educational journey alone. I need your help. Please help me Put A Smile on Young Faces.

Young Faces Smiling has benefited from the participation and endorsements of Mega-Businessman Warren Buffett, Grammy Winning Recording Artist Sean Paul, Apprentice Winner Randal Pinkett, American Idol Winner Taylor Hicks, Pastor Frederick K. C. Price, Grammy Award Winning Singer/Songwriter Rob Thomas, Camille McDonald, model/former “America’s Next Top Model”, and Tara Dowdell, Political Pundit/former “Apprentice” contestant.

The Following People Have also Supported Our Reality Classroom Adventure:

Amaryllis Fox - CEO of Mulu 

Arif Gursel - XBOX/Microsoft Inventor 

Astronomical Kid - X Factor TV Show

BernNadette Stanis - Good Times TV Show,

Dan Rather - CBS Anchor Man 

Dana Herbert/Chef - Next Great Baker TV Show 

Day 26 - Making The Band 4 TV Show 

Daymond John - CEO of FUBU – Shark Tank TV Show 

Donald Lawrence - Gospel Artist

Dr. Fred Price -  Ever Increasing Faith Ministries

Kate Gosselin - John & Kate Plus 8 TV Show

Kyle Weiss - CEO of Fund a Field – Teen Nick Halo TV Show

Toure - MSNBC The Cycle TV Show

Wendy Williams -The Queen of Media 

Zach O Greenburg - Forbes Magazine - Author          And so many more........


Check Out A Few Blogs Featuring YFS:

http://buzz.eewmagazine.com/eew-magazine-buzz-blog/2013/4/12/young-faces-smiling-sherri-shepherd-lends-voice-to-education.html

http://harlemworldmag.com/2010/05/14/ryan-leslie-smiles-in-harlem/#more-21179

https://www.facebook.com/NYAmsterdamNews/posts/254685857914960

http://www.nydailynews.com/news/obama-coming-apollo-fundraiser-accessible-article-1.1004807

http://www.blackgivesback.com/2008_08_01_archive.html#.Uj5FARZKufR

http://www.nfl.com/news/story/09000d5d8277e20d/printable/broncos-carter-takes-charity-trip-to-africa

Featured on a Reality TV Show with Tara Dowdell - Reality Obsessed (Season 1)

http://realityobsessed.com/episode1007.html

Awards

http://www.jamaicans.com/news/events/YGBAward~print.shtml

Certificate of Special Congressional Recognition - From Congressman Charles B. Rangel - Feb 29, 2012

Quotes From Celebrities For Young Faces Smiling:

“The most important ingredient in success is getting a good education and developing the right habits.  All of the students are at the time when they can do both.”

-Warren Buffett, CEO/Founder - Berkshire Hathaway, Inc.

“It was very flattering to hear that your class enjoyed the Fortune Magazine article.  Organizations such as Young Faces Smiling are lynchpin to the successful education of children. Your efforts are admirable.”

-Maverick Carter, CEO/Lebron James/LRMR: Innovative Marketing and Branding

“This is a much needed program that will use media outlets such as television, radio and the internet to reach students in ways that will help our fellow teachers reach them.”

-Anwar F. Robinson, 

American Idol TV Show, Season Four

story:
Short Summary

A lot of you here know me as Tron Bonne, but, my real name is Jessica Diamant. I'm 22 years old and I'm striving to finish my education. In 2012, I had applied and been accepted to Temple University Japan! I was very ready to go and save up money for tickets and to pay for little fees here and there. Sadly, there was one issue. That issue being Financial Viability. They needed you to have access to a certain amount of money to prove you'd be able to support yourself. I don't have that kind of money, nor anyone who can even remotely support me. With your help I should be able to go and achieve my dreams!

What We Need & What You Get

What I truely would need is $35,000 to show my Financial Viability, but if I can even get a fraction of that, it would be extremely helpful!

Now, every single dollar you donate to me will go directly to getting me to Japan and or paying for college expenses. Such as Plane Tickets, Book Costs, semester payment, and general college fees.

Of course I wouldn't ask for all of this without any reward. I'm not completely insane! As any of you Tron Bonne Art fans would suspect, I'll be giving people commissions to whoever donates! There are different levels of donating perks. Each has their own specifics about the reward.

Check the Perk list on the side!

The Impact

Besides you guys helping me finish my schooling, you are actually asissting with a lot more than just that. Some of you who know me, will know this. I was actually born in Yokosuka, Japan and had left there when I was a little baby. All of my life I had heard wonderful stories about how amazing the experience was there. Just taking in all the culture, and the sights. My parents had vowed to take me back at some point.

In 2006, on my 16th birthday I had recieved tickets to go to Japan in that October. Sadly, something had come up with bills and my father had to sell our tickets. I understood and knew my father would do anything to get me there so we could see it. Sadly, in 2009, my father had passed away due to lymphoma. Not even more than a full year had passed and then my mother had succumbed to her cancer.

So, any of you donating to this are proving to me that you're all my heroes. You are helping see my birthplace, get my education and experience my past in ways I could never even imagine.

Also, any of you can feel free to message me at my asktron@gmail.com email if you have ANY questions.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't donate, please, please, pleeeaaase, spread the word! Share this page on your twitters, Facebooks, tumblrs. Like the page here!

Anything you do to spread the word is also help in itself!

story:
Who Is Katelyn?

Katelyn was a normal senior at George Washington High School. She is also student body vice president. That changed after George Washington High School hosted conservative religious speaker Pam Stenzel to advocate for “God’s plan for sexual purity” at a mandatory assembly, Campbell notified the ACLU and the local paper. Once the press began taking interest in the situation, Campbell’s principal wasn’t pleased — in fact, she says he threatened to call Wellesley College, where she has been accepted to study in the fall, to tell them that Campbell is a “backstabber” who has “bad character.” That threat ended up badly backfiring as Wellesley College welcomed her on Twitter "The Wellesley community fosters a living and learning environment where diverse opinions, ideas, and perspectives are not only welcomed, they are encouraged."

Who Is David?

I'm a father of two wonderful children living halfway across the country away from George Washinton High School in Charleston, West Virginia. In fact, I've never met her. The story of Katelyn struck a chord with me; the growing rejection of scientifically supported information that is being pushed on children is horrifying. I want my children, actually I want all children, to be presented with supportable scientific facts in public schools, not religious dogma. I want my children to think, to question, to demand evidence.

The other part is Katelyn's strength and grace through this. I hope that my son or daughter, when faced with the darkness of ignorance, will be willing to stand and shine the light that can only come from an educated and open mind.

The Goal:

The goal of this fund is two-fold. First and foremost, to help Katelyn with her education. The second goal is to financially support her to allow her to educate others. She is a wonderful spokesperson and she can articulate the challenges and goals far better than most.

The Impact

Your contribution will help eliminate 'slut shaming' and show Katelyn that we support her.

story:
Short Summary

Mark O'Brien survived childhood polio to become a poet and journalist.  Although he was paralyzed from the neck down, he left a northern California nursing home to attend UC Berkeley, graduating in 1982 with a degree in English.  As he said in his address to the English department commencement in 1998, "I love this university.  It saved my life."


In that spirit, after Mark's death in 1999, the Mark O'Brien Memorial Scholarship Fund was created, raising about $6500 in the years that followed.  It was revived in 2012 with the release of the movie The Sessions, which told some of Mark's story.


By raising just an additional $3500, we will reach permanent endowment -- an annual award will go to a disabled UC Berkeley English major -- a meaningful legacy for a remarkable man.

Just as Mark wrote all his stories and poems by typing one letter at a time using his mouth-stick, so we will reach this goal one contribution at a time.  No amount is too small.
 
All donors will be recognized on the website of Lemonade Factory, a small press which Mark co-founded.  Depending on the donation amount, you will receive either one, two or three volumes of Mark's poetry as a thank-you.

story:
The Gist of It

Jessica hasn't had it easy, but her fighting spirit shows! Jess has a great talent for Martial Arts: Her confidence, body awareness, and social skills have improved dramatically since she began Martial Arts training. Help Jess continue her training and begin participating in competitions!

What We Need & What You Get

Jess has been invited to compete in a Nationally Ranked tournament, and we need your support to get her there! Help Jess by contributing to the cost of continued training and tournament entry.

With a contribution of 20 dollars or more, receive a handmade para cord bracelet you can proudly wear to show your support!

Your contribution will be used to fund MMA training for a talented 12 year old Martial Artist, and tournament entry! Help boost Jessica's confidence, self esteem and body awareness! All funds received in excess of tournament fees will be put toward furthering Jessica's training.

  • Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate funds right now, you can still help Jessica! Share this campaign on Facebook, via email, by phone and in person! Let everyone know how they can help!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Maya Bradfield and I am trying to raise money to build a Little Free Library for my neighborhood. Building and installing one of these would help bring the community closer together and create bonds with one another. People will be able to visit the Little Free Library and borrow any books that they want for free! People will get to know each other better and interact. I also hope to promote literacy in my neighborhood by building and installing a Little Free Library in my neighborhood.

What We Need

I need $800 to build a Little Free Library for my neighborhood. This money goes towards getting a Little Free Library kit, getting materials to assemble the kit, a handmade sign for the Library, and registering our Library with the Little Free Library organization.

The Impact

This project, if funded and completed, will help the community as a whole. It will help people connect and interact with the other people living near them. People could become more socially active and get to read a good book at the same time!  I will also be stocking the library with some kids books so to help promote literacy with kids in my neighborhood.  This will have a lasting impact in my neighborhood.

Why Am I Doing This?

One of the reasons I am doing this to earn the Girl Scouts Silver Award.  The Silver Award is the highest honor a Girl Scout Cadette can earn.  It is awarded to girls who create a project that has a lasting positive impact in her community.  Building, installing, and maintaining a Little Free Library will definitely have a lasting positive impact in my neighborhood!  I already know of several neighbors who are looking forward to sharing their books and love for reading with others in our community.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute money, then please help get the word out about this project. I think that it will be beneficial to many people and making this happen will make my community a better place. Please share this on any social media websites that you can and share it on Indegogo as well! I appreciate any help that you can offer, even just reading about this campaign. Thank you!

story:
We are:

Wake Up: Young Buddhists and non-Buddhists for a Healthy and Compassionate Society

Wake Up is an active global community of young mindfulness practitioners, aged 18-35, inspired by the teachings of Zen Master and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh. We come together to practice mindfulness in order to take care of ourselves, nourish happiness and contribute to building a healthier and a more compassionate society.

Right Livelihood is a question of ethics and how to produce well-being, not only for ourselves but for all those affected by our work – directly or indirectly’ ~ Thich Nhat Hanh.

We are organizing:

A one month retreat for young adults between 18 and about 35 years old on the theme of Right Livelihood. 

Why?

With our world in transition and our economy in transformation, reflecting on our interaction with and contribution to the world is more important than ever. Many of us have a sense of urgency when it comes to making a change and creating a world we all want to live in. This can bring a lot of stress, anxiety and overwhelming feelings; there is so much to do!

We believe that our young generation is the future, and we also already have so many possibilities to take action right now! As individuals it might be hard to have a big impact or be heard, but as a team, a group, a community, anything is possible.

What?

During this retreat we will be looking into the questions of why are we here? (on this earth, at this workplace, these studies?) What is our contribution? How can we work together? we will try to find out how the practice of mindfulness can help us thrive instead of drown, see possibilities instead of focusing only on what is going wrong, find our own talents and learn to trust in them. Because the way we support ourselves can be an expression of our deepest self.

Together we will be camping at a beautiful location in the French countryside, working and living as a small community, and having the time to come back to ourselves and look inside ourselves for questions and answers. It will be a time of retreat and reflection, a time of reconnecting with nature and get our hands dirty in the earth and a time to play, laugh, sing and dance together!

What We Need

In order to make it possible for many young people to join the Retreat, we have kept the budget very tight and the financial contribution just barely covers the cost of making the Retreat happen. This means that at the moment it would be even difficult to cover the extra cost of food for staff and organizers.

Therefore we need some extra financial support in order to provide:
  1. Scholarships - Supporting passionate young adults to join for 1 months.
  2. Teachers salary - Permaculture teachers have agreed to come for a very low revenue, we'd like to offer them more.
  3. Organizing team expenses - The organizing team's food and travel costs.

Financial picture:
1 scholarship for 1 month: 600 Euros (food and materials)
1 teacher's expenses for 1 week: 400 Euros for travel costs and 75 Euros for food. The additional salary is flexible and depends on how many funds we can raise.
1 organizing team member for 1 month: 675 (food and travel expenses)

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget you can also help us tremendously by spreading the word, sharing the information about our campaign and ignite enthusiasm in others by expressing your enthusiasm for our project!

We are grateful for all your support! =)

story:
Take a closer look at 365give before you donate



 


What People are Saying About 365give:

"It was a pleasure and a privilege to be a part of this project. Definitely a highlight of this school year for me. I wholeheartedly believe in the project and was glad to see a team of wonderful teachers embark on this journey. "

Chantal Trudeau - Principal - Pauline Johnson Elementary

"365give Challenge allowed students to apply the skills they are learning in class in a real life setting, which makes learning more fun and easier to understand...Giving to others in need and volunteering your time should be part of our everyday living and responsibility as good citizens.                             Lindsay Storry -Teacher Grade 2

"I have been so touched by the work you've done with 365give project. This is truly the most inspirational lesson I think any young child can receive and I know the memories these children have will be all for the better for it. I have personally used the messages you've provided to help reinforce the need for giving, charity and acts of kindness when the kids are with me."                                                                                                                             Ian - Parent


Read more comments by teachers, students, and parents


Have a question? Read our FAQ's!

Q. What is the purpose of the Crowdfunder Campaign?

The purpose of the the 365give Crowdfunder campaign is to raise money!  The campaign is also a chance for supporters to help take 365give to next level. Our mission is to EMPOWER children through education to GIVE every day. This takes resources and social support to make it happen.


Q. How do I learn more about 365give?

You can visit our website at www.365give.ca or check us out onTwitter,Facebook orYouTube.

Q. I notice there are incentives listed to in each crowdfunding campaign.  What is an incentive?

By definition an incentive is “something that motivates an individual to perform an action”.  While most people make donations from the goodness of their hearts, it is customary in a crowdfunding campaign to offer rewards for various donations. Ours are very grass roots and simple but they come from our heart. 

Q. When do I get my perk for contributing?

Perks will be distributed after the campaign is complete. We are running the campaign for a total of 45 days so your perk will come quickly. Please  note that an immediate email confirmation is send to all donors to confirm receipt with a note of thanks in recognition and  appreciation of your support.

Q. What happens if you exceed the $5000 listed goal? 

We are hoping to do just that. Our goal is to raise at least $75,000 by the end of 2014. 365give has big goals and dreams. Changing the world isn't easy but with your help and the commitment to teach the next generation of children to give - we know we can do it. 

Q. How can I get more involved?

Your help, no matter how big or small, will get us closer to our mission. Here are additional ways you can support 365give once you have donated:

  • Share the 365give Challenge idea with your children's school principal via our website. Whether it is a private or public school, we are happy to get the 365give Challenge out to as many schools as we can reach. 

  • Become a Community Partner. We are working hard to create Community Partnerships with both companies and other not-for-profit organizations that can help teachers inspire their students to give in unique ways both locally and globally. Take a look at our Community Page and see if there is a good fit for your organization. 

  • Help us spread the word. Connected with media outlets? Help us spread our message and reach out to the media to get them involved! The greater exposure the better! Keep them in the know about 365give and our mission. We are happy to forward any information that will help to spread our message.

  • Volunteer Your Time. As a grass routes organization we are always looking for extra hands and expertise that will support our movement. Contact us and let's talk about how we can work together to change the world!

  • Share our campaign and mission on your networks. Love Social Media? Share our posts, tweet about us,like us on Facebook. Share our mission and stories with everyone you know. 

  • Write a post on your blog. Use your writing skills to spread the message of 365give.

  • Connected with any celebrities, musical artists, athletes, etc? We would love the opportunity to invite them to become a 365give Ambassador.  

  • Technical Brilliance? Know of a cool way to get us more exposure using your technical skills? Tell us about it - we are always open to improving!

  • Corporate Sponsor? Do you have a company or know of someone who has a company that would like to brand themselves as part of a new giving movement? Do they support the education of children and ground breaking scientific research? Please send them our way and we will take the time to talk and meet with every single person.

  • We can’t think of everything! If you have a skill that you think can assist in spreading our message, we are all ears! We all have something to offer - so let us know what you would like to do.


          For any further inquiries contact changetheworld@365give.ca

                                                  www.365give.ca
story_txt:
Take a closer look at 365give before you donate What People are Saying About 365give:"It
 was a pleasure and a privilege to be a part of this project. Definitely
 a highlight of this school year for me. I wholeheartedly believe in the
 project and was glad to see a team of wonderful teachers embark on this
 journey. "Chantal Trudeau - Principal - Pauline Johnson Elementary"365give Challenge allowed students to apply the skills they are learning in class in a real life 
setting, which makes learning more fun and easier to understand...Giving to others
 in need and volunteering your time should be part of our everyday 
living and responsibility as good citizens.                             Lindsay Storry -Teacher Grade 2"I
 have been so touched by the work you've done with 365give project. This
 is truly the most inspirational lesson I think any young child can 
receive and I know the memories these children have will be all for the 
better for it. I have personally used the messages you've provided to 
help reinforce the need for giving, charity and acts of kindness when 
the kids are with me."                                                                                                                             Ian - ParentRead more comments by teachers, students, and parentsHave a question? Read our FAQ's!
Q. What is the purpose of the Crowdfunder Campaign?The purpose of the the 365give Crowdfunder campaign is to raise money!  The campaign is also a chance for supporters to help take 365give to next level. Our mission is to EMPOWER children through education to GIVE every day. This takes resources and social support to make it happen.Q. How do I learn more about 365give?You can visit our website at www.365give.ca or check us out onTwitter,Facebook orYouTube.Q. I notice there are incentives listed to in each crowdfunding campaign.  What is an incentive?By definition an incentive is “something that motivates an individual to perform an action”.  While most people make donations from the goodness of their hearts, it is customary in a crowdfunding campaign to offer rewards for various donations. Ours are very grass roots and simple but they come from our heart. Q. When do I get my perk for contributing?Perks will be distributed after the campaign is complete. We are running the campaign for a total of 45 days so your perk will come quickly. Please  note that an immediate email confirmation is send to all donors to confirm receipt with a note of thanks in recognition and  appreciation of your support. Q. What happens if you exceed the $5000 listed goal? We are hoping to do just that. Our goal is to raise at least $75,000 by the end of 2014. 365give has big goals and dreams. Changing the world isn't easy but with your help and the commitment to teach the next generation of children to give - we know we can do it. Q. How can I get more involved?Your help, no matter how big or small, will get us closer to our mission. Here are additional ways you can support 365give once you have donated:
Share the 365give Challenge idea with your children's school principal via our website. Whether it is a private or public school, we are happy to get the 365give Challenge out to as many schools as we can reach. 
Become a Community Partner. We are working hard to create Community Partnerships with both companies and other not-for-profit organizations that can help teachers inspire their students to give in unique ways both locally and globally. Take a look at our Community Page and see if there is a good fit for your organization.  
Help us spread the word. Connected with media outlets? Help us spread our message and reach out to the media to get them involved! The greater exposure the better! Keep them in the know about 365give and our mission. We are happy to forward any information that will help to spread our message.

Volunteer Your Time. As a grass routes organization we are always looking for extra hands and expertise that will support our movement. Contact us and let's talk about how we can work together to change the world!
Share our campaign and mission on your networks. Love Social Media? Share our posts, tweet about us,like us on Facebook. Share our mission and stories with everyone you know. 
Write a post on your blog. Use your writing skills to spread the message of 365give.
Connected with any celebrities, musical artists, athletes, etc? We would love the opportunity to invite them to become a 365give Ambassador.  
Technical Brilliance? Know of a cool way to get us more exposure using your technical skills? Tell us about it - we are always open to improving!
Corporate Sponsor? Do you have a company or know of someone who has a company that would like to brand themselves as part of a new giving movement? Do they support the education of children and ground breaking scientific research? Please send them our way and we will take the time to talk and meet with every single person.
We can’t think of everything! If you have a skill that you think can assist in spreading our message, we are all ears! We all have something to offer - so let us know what you would like to do.          For any further inquiries contact changetheworld@365give.ca                                                  www.365give.ca

story:
La Salle ENACTUS and

The Mshomba library

This year, La Salle University’s ENACTUS Team has chosen a worthy project and really needs your support. Dr. Richard Mshomba, class of 1985, and his wife, Elaine, are building a library in the outskirts of Arusha, Tanzania. The Mshomba's have already started constructing the basic structure for the 40ft by 24ft library. The library is not yet complete, and ENACTUS plans on devoting its time and resources to finishing the job, but we need your help to make it happen!

La Salle University’s ENACTUS team is an 8-time national qualifying business competition group. We are a community of students, academics, and business leaders committed to using the power of entrepreneurial action to transform lives and shape a better, more sustainable world. Team Project Tanzania is a part of La Salle's ENACTUS organization and wants to contribute to Dr. Mshomba's dream of having a library in his home village.  

Dr. Richard Mshomba

Dr. Mshomba is from Tanzania. He has been a professor at La Salle since 1991. He received the 2005 Lindback Award for Distinguished Teaching, the 2009 Distinguished LaSallian Educator Award, and the 2013 Warren E. Smith Award from the African American Alumni Association for his commitment to service and success in his professional career. Dr. Mshomba is a true Lasallian leader, his ongoing devotion to this project is impressive and worthy of our attention and support.

Dr. Mshomba has given us the privilege to aid in his dream of completing the library.  

Project Tanzania

The library is the first step in helping provide children in Tanzania a better education.  

Educational services in Tanzania result in very poor student performance. In 2012, 60% of the 411,000 students who sat for the National Form IV Exam (taken in the final year of secondary school) failed.  Many teachers within the educational system have a profiteering mentality.  Most students in Tanzania don’t have access to textbooks and other learning resources. The library will give students access to textbooks and computers and provide them a quiet, safe, and well-lit place to study. The library will serve the entire community. It will have specific services for the more than 5,000 students from 7 elementary and secondary schools in Sinon and neighboring communities.

What the library still needs...

Your donation will help complete the library's infrastructure. The quantity needed to complete this entire project is US$15,000.  We are also exploring other avenues to raise the funds needed to finish the library. The Mshomba's have been working closely with a group of six very capable, honest, and dedicated volunteers in Tanzania in planning and supervising the construction of the library. They will continue working with them to manage the provision of library services.

The library still needs windows, doors, and gutters. The property that the library is being built on is approximately an acre in size; a wall needs to be constructed around its parameter with a 90-yard walking path to the entrance of the library. The Mshomba's are making arrangements with colleagues in Sinon and neighboring communities to donate funds for shelves and books.

No matter what amount Project Tanzania is able to raise, it will be completed, but without your help it could take years.

story:
Who Was Marchesa Minucci?

On top of a box in the attic of an unused building in Albany lay a photograph of a beautiful Italian woman.  Looking through the box I found newspaper accounts, and a photo album, more photos of this beautiful woman who, by her photos, appeared to be an actress or singer around the turn of the 20th century.  But who was this "Marquaza" as she was known.

The attic of the building is filled with boxes such as the one above and rows and rows of VHS tapes, newspaper, books and other documents all relating to the early Italian history of America.

But we have no idea what is in these boxes. What stories need to be told?  What part of history did the people hidden in these boxes play in the American experience?

We plan on finding out.

We are launching this campaign to be able to inventory this collection of early Italian American history that is owned by the American Italian Heritage Association and History Museum in Albany, NY.

We need to get the necessary equipment, iMac, scanner, etc., to be able to digitize this valuable collection of early Italian American history before we lose it. We want to share this information and be able to bring these stories to life in future museum exhibits.

The American Italian Heritage Association and Museum began in 1979 as the American Italian Heritage Association in Utica and moved in the late 1990s to Albany NY to create a national museum.  The museum is a 501c non-profit NYS organization so donations are tax deductible.

Much of the material in the attic was collected over the years but never documented so this wealth of information needs to be categorized and documented, scanned and made available to all those who are interested in researching Italian American history in America.
